meaning_1: various opinions; proliferation; endless conceptualization; lit. expanding; spreading
example_1: nippapañc'ārāmass'āyaṃ dhammo nippapañcaratino n'āyaṃ dhammo papañc'ārāmassa papañcaratino'ti
example_2:
yo n'āccasārī na paccasārī,
sabbaṃ accagamā imaṃ papañcaṃ,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yāvatā papañcassa gati tāvatā channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati. channaṃ, āvuso, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā papañcanirodho papañcavūpasamo'ti.
sbs_example_4: yatonidānaṃ, bhikkhu, purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti. ettha ce n'atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ.
sbs_example_5: na saññasaññī na visaññasaññī, no'pi asaññī na vibhūtasaññī. evaṃ sametassa vibhoti rūpaṃ, saññānidānā hi papañcasaṅkhā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: offence requiring suspension; lit. offence requiring involvement of the community from start to finish
commentary:
(VIN 6.8.5) saṅghādiseso'ti yaṃ vuttaṃ,
taṃ suṇohi yathātathaṃ,
saṅgho'va deti parivāsaṃ,
mūlāya paṭikassati,
mānattaṃ deti abbheti,
ten'etaṃ iti vuccati.
example_1: sañcetanikā sukkavissaṭṭhi aññatra supin'antā saṅghādiseso.
example_2: tass'eva āpattinikāyassa nāmakammaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tena'pi vuccati, saṅghādiseso'ti.
sbs_example_3: yāvatatiyañ'ce samanubhāsiyamāno taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ. no ce paṭinissajjeyya, saṅghādiseso.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fetter; chain; bond; thing which binds; lit. yoking together
commentary:
(THa) saṃyojanan'ti vaṭṭadukkhena saddhiṃ santānaṃ saṃyojanato vaṭṭe osīdāpanasamatthaṃ dasavidham'pi saṃyojanaṃ.
(SNa) kiṃ su saṃyojano'ti kiṃ saṃyojano kiṃ bandhano?
example_1:
appamādarato bhikkhu,
pamāde bhayadassi vā,
saṃyojanaṃ aṇuṃ thūlaṃ,
ḍahaṃ aggī'va gacchati.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa bhikkhuno viharato appakasiren'eva saṃyojanāni paṭippassambhanti pūtikāni bhavantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: yathā ca uppannassa saṃyojanassa pahānaṃ hoti tañ'ca pajānāti, yathā ca pahīnassa saṃyojanassa āyatiṃ anuppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti.
sbs_example_4: kiṃ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: spiritual path; spiritual practice; holy life; celibacy
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti
example_2: ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
sbs_example_3: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ
sbs_example_4: vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti, khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (vinaya) invitation ceremony at the end of the rains retreat; lit. inviting
example_1: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadah'uposathe pannarase pavāraṇāya puṇṇāya puṇṇamāya rattiyā bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto abbhokāse nisinno hoti.
example_2: saṃvaseyya vā'ti ukkhittakena saddhiṃ uposathaṃ vā pavāraṇaṃ vā saṅghakammaṃ vā karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihat'ādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu anvaddhamāsaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya, idān'eva kho ahaṃ jānāmi, ayam'pi kira dhammo sutt'āgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: uddiṭṭhā kho, āyasmanto, terasa saṅghādisesā dhammā, nava paṭham'āpattikā cattāro yāvatatiyakā.

meaning_1: control of the mind; sense restraint
example_1: so iminā ariyena indriyasaṃvarena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ abyāsekasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti
example_2: so iminā ca ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato, imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena indriyasaṃvarena samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena satisampajaññena samannāgato vivittaṃ sen'āsanaṃ bhajiṃ
sbs_example_3: tīṇi'p'āhaṃ sucaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni. ko c'āhāro tiṇṇaṃ sucaritānaṃ? indriyasaṃvaro'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: kalyāṇamittatā sīlānaṃ āhāro, indriyasaṃvaro brahmacariyassa āhāro, avisaṃvādanā mittānaṃ āhāro
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
idha vassaṃ vasissāmi,
idha hem'antagimhisu,
iti bālo vicinteti,
antarāyaṃ na bujjhati.
example_2: adhivāsetu ca me bhavaṃ gotamo verañjāyaṃ vassa-avāsaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā'ti

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, cāgadhanaṃ.
example_2: saddhāya vaḍḍhati, sīlena vaḍḍhati, sutena vaḍḍhati, cāgena vaḍḍhati, paññāya vaḍḍhati.
sbs_example_3: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati

example_1:
mettañ'ca sabbalokasmi,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ,
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyañ'ca,
asambādhaṃ averamasapattaṃ.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
tasmā hi bhūtā nisāmetha sabbe, mettaṃ karotha mānusiyā pajāya.
divā ca ratto ca haranti ye baliṃ, tasmā hi ne rakkhatha appamattā.
sbs_example_4: mettāya cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādas'ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti. evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti? aniccaṃ, bhante.

meaning_1: looking on; mental poise; mental balance; equanimity; equipoise; non-reactivity; composure
example_1: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ upekkhā'ti
example_2: upekkhaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. upekkhañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo paṭigho so pahīyissati.
sbs_example_3: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb'eva somanassadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā, adukkham'asukhaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: faith (in); belief (in); trust (in); lit. putting heart
example_1:
asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.
example_2:
saddhā bījaṃ tapo vuṭṭhi,
paññā me yuganaṅgalaṃ,
hirī īsā mano yottaṃ,
sati me phālapācanaṃ.
sbs_example_3: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati

example_1: atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantesu pāṭaligāmikesu upāsakesu suñña-agāraṃ pāvisi
example_2: kacci nu kho'haṃ suññ'āgāre abhiramāmī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: who has entered the stream; entered the first stage of the path
example_1: sant'ettha, bhikkhave, upāsikāyo sot'āpannā, santi sakadāgāminiyo, santi anāgāminiyo. sabbā tā, bhikkhave, upāsikāyo anipphalā kālaṅ'katā'ti.
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.

example_1:

caraṇā nāgassa tepare,

meaning_1: insight; penetrating internal vision; introspection; lit. seeing distinctly

example_2: ko pana, bhante, hetu ko paccayo kalyāṇassa kammassa kiriyāya kalyāṇassa kammassa pavattiyā'ti? ... yoniso manasikāro kho, mahāli, hetu, yoniso manasikāro paccayo kalyāṇassa kammassa kiriyāya kalyāṇassa kammassa pavattiyā.
sbs_example_3: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, nāmarūpaṃ? vedanā, saññā, cetanā, phasso, manasikāro, idaṃ vuccati nāmaṃ.
sbs_example_4: jānato ahaṃ passato āsavānaṃ khayaṃ vadāmi, no ajānato no apassato. yoniso ca manasikāraṃ ayoniso ca manasikāraṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: compassion; sympathy; kindness (towards unfortunate beings); lit. action
example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma ekaṃ puggalaṃ duggataṃ durūpetaṃ disvā karuṇāyeyya, evam'eva sabbasatte karuṇāya pharatī'ti
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
sbs_example_3: iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ karuṇāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
sbs_example_4: buddho susuddho karuṇāmah'aṇṇavo, yo'ccantasuddhabbarañāṇalocano, lokassa pāp'ūpakilesaghātako
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, antevāsikamyatā no samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo ācariyo, so eva vo ācariyo hotu.
example_2: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā.
sbs_example_3: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
sbs_example_4: so aparena samayena saṃvāsam'anvāya vissāsam'anvāya ācariyam'pi upajjhāyam'pi evam'āha, apetha, kiṃ pana tumhe jānāthā'ti!
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
upajjhāyo maṃ avaca,
ito gacchāma sīvaka,
gāme me vasati kāyo,
araññaṃ me gato mano,
semānakopi gacchāmi,
n'atthi saṅgo vijānatan'ti.
example_2: upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ. sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
sbs_example_3: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
sbs_example_4: so aparena samayena saṃvāsam'anvāya vissāsam'anvāya ācariyam'pi upajjhāyam'pi evam'āha, apetha, kiṃ pana tumhe jānāthā'ti!

meaning_1: regret; shame in wrongdoing; respect for others
example_1: dve'me, bhikkhave, dhammā sukkā lokaṃ pālenti. katame dve? hirī ca ottappañ'ca.
example_2: ahirikassa purisapuggalassa hirī hoti parikkamanāya, anottāpissa purisapuggalassa ottappaṃ hoti parikkamanāya, appassutassa purisapuggalassa bāhusaccaṃ hoti parikkamanāya
sbs_example_3: ime kho hirī ca ottappañ'ca lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya atītasmiṃ rūpasmiṃ anapekkho hoti, anāgataṃ rūpaṃ n'ābhinandati, paccuppannassa rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti
example_2: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako ... viññāṇasmiṃ nibbindati, nibbidā virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sbs_example_3: ime dhammā ek'antanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattantī'ti, ek'aṃsena, upāli, dhāreyyāsi, eso dhammo eso vinayo etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
sbs_example_4: evaṃ rūpassa nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

notes: a familiar form of address among monks
example_1:
cittasmiṃ vasībhūt'āmhi,
iddhipādā subhāvitā,
sabbabandhanamutt'āmhi,
na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.
example_2: na kho pan'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatvā lokassa antaṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: underlying tendency (to); inherent inclination (to); dormant disposition (towards); lit. sleeping alongside
example_1:
yassa-anusayā na santi keci,
mūlā ca akusalā samūhatāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
example_2: nibbāne ca santadassāvī bhavissāmi, anusayā ca me samugghātaṃ gacchissanti, kiccakārī ca bhavissāmi, satthā ca me pariciṇṇo bhavissati mettāvatāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idh'ānanda, bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān'ābhinivesa-ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat'ānanda, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (of mental defilement) complete quenching; total emancipation; complete cooling
example_1: kāmānañ'c'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, pariññaṃ paññāpemi, rūpānañ'ca pariññaṃ paññāpemi, vedanānañ'ca pariññaṃ paññāpemi, diṭṭh'eva dhamme nicchāto nibbuto sītibhūto anupādā parinibbānaṃ paññāpemī'ti.
example_2: buddho so bhagavā bodhāya dhammaṃ deseti, danto so bhagavā damathāya dhammaṃ deseti, santo so bhagavā samathāya dhammaṃ deseti, tiṇṇo so bhagavā taraṇāya dhammaṃ deseti, parinibbuto so bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammaṃ desetī'ti.
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parinibbānāya, pāṇ'ātipātissa purisapuggalassa pāṇ'ātipātā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kacci nu kho me attā sīlato na upavadatī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
example_2: puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni.
sbs_example_3: dānaṃ dadantu saddhāya, sīlaṃ rakkhantu sabbadā, bhāvan'ābhiratā hontu, gacchantu devatāgatā.
sbs_example_4:
kikī'va aṇḍaṃ, camarī'va vāladhiṃ. piyaṃ'va puttaṃ,
nayanaṃ'va ekakaṃ. tath'eva sīlaṃ, anurakkhamānā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (vinaya) boundary in which legal procedures are performed
commentary: (VINa) sīmaṃ sammannatī'ti navaṃ sīmaṃ bandhati. kurundiyaṃ pana udak'ukkhepaparicchindane'pi dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ.
example_1: yattakā bhikkhū tassa uposathakammassa pattā yuttā anurūpā, sabb'antimena paricchedena cattāro bhikkhū pakatattā, saṅghena anukkhitā, te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā ekasīmayaṃ ṭhitā.
example_2: upasampādessāmī'ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariyaṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ. dvīhi kammavācāhi dukkaṭā.
sbs_example_3: chand'āharaṇapārisuddhiāharaṇāni, pana imissaṃ sīmāyaṃ hatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā nisinnānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhāvato n'atthi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: element of awakening; factor of enlightenment
example_1: kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati sattasu bojjh'aṅgesu
example_2: samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.
sbs_example_3: cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā bahulīkatā sattabojjh'aṅge paripūrenti
sbs_example_4: satta'p'āhaṃ bojjh'aṅge sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre. ko c'āhāro sattannaṃ bojjh'aṅgānaṃ? cattāro satipaṭṭhānā'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: calmness; tranquillity; tranquillization; peace; stillness; serenity
example_1: nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.
example_2: sukham'p'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, saupanisaṃ vadāmi, no anupanisaṃ. kā ca, bhikkhave, sukhassa upanisā? passaddhī'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ
sbs_example_3: bojjh'aṅgo satisaṅkhāto dhammānaṃ vicayo tathā viriyam'pītipassaddhi bojjh'aṅgā ca tathā'pare samādh'upekkhabojjh'aṅgā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: investigation of reality; examining states; analysing the teaching
example_1: santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgaṃ, atthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgo'ti pajānāti
example_2: yasmiñ'ca kho, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo pītisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.
sbs_example_3: bojjh'aṅgo satisaṅkhāto dhammānaṃ vicayo tathā viriyam'pītipassaddhi bojjh'aṅgā ca tathā'pare samādh'upekkhabojjh'aṅgā.
sbs_example_4: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (of actions) result; outcome; consequence; fruit; lit. ripening
example_1:
atha pāpāni kammāni,
karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
pacch'āssa kaṭukaṃ hoti,
vipāko hissa pāpako'ti.
example_2: yo ca kho, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yathā vedanīyaṃ ayaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathāssa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso hoti, okāso paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhunā tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ ādīnavo upaparikkhitabbo, iti'pi'me vitakkā akusalā, iti'pi'me vitakkā sāvajjā, iti'pi'me vitakkā dukkhavipākā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.3) iti cittamano'ti yaṃ cittaṃ taṃ mano, yaṃ mano taṃ cittaṃ.
example_1:
dunniggahassa lahuno,
yatthakāmanipātino,
cittassa damatho sādhu,
cittaṃ dantaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.
example_2: yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, akālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, akālo upekkhāsambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
sbs_example_4: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jāgariyaṃ anuyutto viharāhi, divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhehi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: sublime state; heavenly state; divine dwelling; collective name of the meditations on friendliness, compassion, happiness for and equanimity; lit. gods mansion
notes: a collective term for the states of friendliness, compassion, appreciation and equanimity
example_1: so cattāro brahmavihāre bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā brahmalok'ūpago ahosi.
example_2: handa mayaṁ caturabrahmavihārā obhāsanaṁ karomase
sbs_example_3: ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: attending mindfully; being present with mindfulness
example_1: sambahulā bhikkhuniyo catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittā viharantiyo
example_2: yā kho, āvuso visākha, cittassa ekaggatā ayaṃ samādhi, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā samādhinimittā, cattāro sammappadhānā samādhiparikkhārā.
sbs_example_3: ānāpānassati bhikkhave bhāvitā bahulīkatā cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti
sbs_example_4: tayo satipaṭṭhānā yad'ariyo sevati yad'ariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yoggācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, satthu pavivittassa viharato sāvakā vivekaṃ n'ānusikkhanti
example_2:
methunam'anuyuttassa,
vighātaṃ brūhi mārisa,
sutvāna tava sāsanaṃ,
viveke sikkhissāmase.
sbs_example_3:
araññe rukkhamūlesu, kandarāsu guhāsu ca.
vivekam'anubrūhantā, vihaṃsu tap'parāyanā
sbs_example_4: bhikkhu vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi, savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
pamādo rajo pamādo,
pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya,
abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
example_2: ayaṃ kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamo vihato āloko uppanno
sbs_example_3: arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa na tādiso chando hoti adhisīlasikkhāsamādāne seyyathā'pi aññesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, na tādiso chando hoti adhicittasikkhāsamādāne seyyathā'pi aññesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
example_2:
etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ,
bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto,
kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno,
ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.
sbs_example_3: anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
sbs_example_4:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: mindfulness while breathing in and out; mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation
example_1: yañ'hi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pi, ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pī'ti.
example_2: disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.
sbs_example_3: aniccasaññā, anattasaññā, asubhasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, ānāpānassati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: scripture; discourse; sacred text; lit. thread
commentary: (MNa) ubhatovibhaṅganiddesakhandhakaparivārā, suttanipāte maṅgalasuttaratanasuttanālakasuttatuvaṭṭakasuttāni, aññam'pi ca suttanāmakaṃ tathāgatavacanaṃ suttan'ti veditabbaṃ.
notes:
other possible derivations that have been suggested are
√su 4 ṇā (hear) + ta
su + √vac > vak > uk + ta "well said"
example_1: sammukhā ce'pi mayaṃ, bho bhāradvāja, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ passeyyāma, sammukhā'pi naṃ vadeyyāma, bhūnahu samaṇo gotamo'ti. taṃ kissa hetu? evañ'hi no sutte ocaratī'ti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
sbs_example_3: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
caraṃ vā yadi vā tiṭṭhaṃ,
nisinno uda vā sayaṃ,
yo vitakkaṃ vitakketi,
pāpakaṃ gehanissitaṃ.
example_2: paṭhamaṃ pan'āvuso, jhānaṃ katiaṅgikan'ti? paṭhamaṃ kho, āvuso, jhānaṃ pañc'aṅgikaṃ. idh'āvuso, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa bhikkhuno vitakko ca vattati, vicāro ca pīti ca sukhañ'ca citt'ekaggatā ca.
sbs_example_3: vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
sbs_example_4: tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ vitakkasaṅkhārasaṇṭhānaṃ manasikaroto ye pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi te pahīyanti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: perception; conception; recognition; third of the five aggregates
example_1:
saññaṃ pariññā vitareyya oghaṃ,
pariggahesu muni n'opalitto,
abbūḷhasallo caram'appamatto,
n'āsīsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.
example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, saññā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, saññākāyā, rūpasaññā, saddasaññā, gandhasaññā, rasasaññā, phoṭṭhabbasaññā, dhammasaññā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saññā.
sbs_example_3: saññā anattā. saññā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ saññā ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca saññāya, evaṃ me saññā hotu, evaṃ me saññā mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: nīlam'pi sañjānāti, pītakam'pi sañjānāti, lohitakam'pi sañjānāti, odātam'pi sañjānāti. sañjānātī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā saññā'ti vuccati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: dependency; physical support; reliance; something one depends on
example_1:
attaṃ pahāya anupādiyāno,
ñāṇe'pi so nissayaṃ no karoti,

meaning_1: highest (of); unsurpassed (by); incomparable (to); superior (to); lit. nothing higher

meaning_1: (vinaya) elder; senior monk; monk with ten or more years as a monk; lit. lasting
commentary:
(VINa) thero vā'ti ādīsu vayovuḍḍh'ādīsu yo vā so vā hotu, paripuṇṇadasavassatāya thero vā ūnapañcavassatāya navo vā atirekapañcavassatāya majjhimo vā'ti attho.
(SNa) navo'ti aparipuṇṇapañcavasso hi bhikkhu navo nāma hoti, pañcavassato paṭṭhāya majjhimo, dasavassato paṭṭhāya thero.
example_1:
na tena thero so hoti,
yen'assa palitaṃ siro,
paripakko vayo tassa,
moghajiṇṇo'ti vuccati.
example_2:
yamhi saccañ'ca dhammo ca,
ahiṃsā saṃyamo damo,
sa ve vantamalo dhīro,
thero iti pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: tassa me therassa sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ

meaning_1: discovery (of); finding (of); attainment (of); achievement (of); lit. arrival
example_1: acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yāvañ'c'idaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okāsa-adhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.
example_2: ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: personal experience (of); intimate experience (of); personal realization (of); lit. personally doing
example_1: ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā
example_2: yassa yassa ca abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññā sacchikiriyāya tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
sbs_example_3:

commentary:
(VIN 2.5.1.4) dhammo nāma buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atth'ūpasañhito, dhamm'ūpasañhito.
(DNa) dhamman'ti suttaṃ.
example_1: imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.
example_2:
idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,
n'āññesu dhammesu visuddhim'āhu,
yaṃ nissitā tattha subhaṃ vadānā,
paccekasaccesu puthū niviṭṭhā.
sbs_example_3: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi
sbs_example_4: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya.

example_2: rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ, rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ. bahū hi tassa bhoto gotamassa khattiyapaṇḍitā'pi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitā'pi gahapatipaṇḍitā'pi samaṇapaṇḍitā'pi abhippasannā vinītā ariye ñāye dhamme kusale'ti.

meaning_1: Such Become; Realised; being in such a state; arrived at the truth; epithet of the Buddha
notes: Bhikkhu Sujāta: the EBTs give a fairly extensive set of interpretations for tathāgata, for example, "as he says, so he does". The overall sense is of one who speaks and acts in accordance with his realization of the truth, which fits the translation "the Realized One".
example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: n'āhaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, passāmi ... yo imesaṃ pañhānaṃ veyyākaraṇena cittaṃ ārādheyya, aññatra tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā ito vā pana sutvā.
sbs_example_3: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
sbs_example_4: vedanānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā anupādāvimutto, bhikkhave, tathāgato.

example_1: yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassa upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati maraṇaṃ.

meaning_1: mental formation; mental activity; thought processes; fourth of the five aggregates; lit. making together
example_1: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

example_2: so phasso anicco'ti passati, vedanā aniccā'ti passati, saññā aniccā'ti passati, saṅkhārā aniccā'ti passati, viññāṇaṃ aniccan'ti passati. tassa dhāt'ārammaṇam'eva cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.

meaning_1: acquiring; appropriating; taking possession; grasping; clinging; identifying; lit. taking near
commentary: (SNa) upādānan'ti daḷhaggahaṇaṃ vuccati. daḷh'attho hi ettha upasaddo upāyāsaupakaṭṭh'ādīsu viya. pañcakāmaguṇikarāgass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ayam'ettha saṅkhepo.
example_1: pañcasu kho, nāgita, upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay'ānupassino viharato upādāne pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti, eso tassa nissando'ti.
example_2: upādāniye ca, bhikkhave, dhamme desessāmi upādānañ'ca. taṃ suṇātha. katame ca, bhikkhave, upādāniyā dhammā, katamaṃ upādānaṃ?
sbs_example_3: saṅkhittena pañc'upādānakkhandhā dukkhā
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: saḷ'āyatananirodho, saḷ'āyatananirodhā, phassanirodho, phassanirodhā, vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā, taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā, upādānanirodho

meaning_1: full moon or new moon observance day
example_1: suṇātu me bhante saṅgho? ajj'uposatho pannaraso, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya.
example_2: ayaṃ hem'anto'tu, asmiñ'ca utumhi aṭṭha uposathā, iminā pakkhena, eko uposatho sampatto, satta uposathā atikkantā, aṭṭha uposathā paripuṇṇā.
sbs_example_3: sammajjanī, padīpo ca, udakaṃ āsanena ca, uposathassa etāni, pubbakaraṇan'ti vuccati.

example_1: sabbamaññitānaṃ tv'eva, bhikkhu, samatikkamā muni santo'ti vuccati. muni kho pana, bhikkhu, santo na jāyati, na jīyati, na mīyati, na kuppati, na piheti.
example_2: ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā
sbs_example_3: sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati

example_1: tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tatth'eva dānaṃ detha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānan'ti.
example_2:
puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.
sbs_example_3: puññāni pakatāni me sukhañ'ca tividhaṃ dentu. khippaṃ pāpetha vo'mataṃ.
sbs_example_4: bhikkhū pan'eva kulesu nimantitā bhuñjanti, tatra ce sā bhikkhunī vosāsamānarūpā ṭhitā hoti, idha sūpaṃ detha, idha odanaṃ dethā'ti.

commentary: (VIN 1.4.1.1) cīvaraṃ nāma channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ, vikappan'upagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, santuṭṭhā bhavissāma itarītarena cīvarena, itarītaracīvarasantuṭṭhiyā ca vaṇṇavādino, na ca cīvarahetu anesanaṃ appatirūpaṃ āpajjissāma.
example_2: yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā
sbs_example_3: pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti, sapattabhāro'va ḍeti. evam'eva kho bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena.
sbs_example_4: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsamakasavāt'ātapasiriṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ
sbs_example_5: aparikkhittaṃ hoti, yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: to the Buddha; for the Buddha
example_1: ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho therā bhikkhū yāvatako ahosi sabbeh'eva saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo, taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesuṃ.
example_2: atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo mahatiyā kaṃsapātiyā pāyāsaṃ vaḍḍhetvā bhagavato upanāmesi, bhuñjatu bhavaṃ gotamo pāyasaṃ.
sbs_example_3: namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
sbs_example_4: tatra kho bhagavā pañcavaggiye bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

meaning_1: to him; for him; to that; for that
example_1:
kāmesu brahmacariyavā,
vītataṇho sadā sato,
saṅkhāya nibbuto bhikkhu,
tassa no santi iñjitā.
example_2: tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjatha, rakkhatha cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, cakkhu'ndriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjatha.
sbs_example_3: namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
sbs_example_4: ādittasmiṃ agārasmiṃ, yaṃ nīharati bhājanaṃ. taṃ tassa hoti atthāya, no ca yaṃ tattha ḍayhati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati. pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati. pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati. kucchismiṃ sati jighacchāpipāsā paññāyati.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amussa āsīvisassa ghoravisassa hatthaṃ vā aṅguṭṭhaṃ vā dajjā yaṃ jaññā, imin'āhaṃ daṭṭho maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti?
sbs_example_3: na sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya, hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso.
sbs_example_5: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ saṃkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṃ bandhitvā, taṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttareyyan'ti.

meaning_1: hell; hell realm; lit. no good fortune
example_1:
yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.
example_2: abhabbo taṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, yaṃ kammaṃ katvā nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā pettivisayaṃ vā upapajjeyya, abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.
sbs_example_3:
na hi dhammo adhammo ca, ubho samavipākino.
adhammo nirayaṃ neti, dhammo pāpeti suggatiṃ.
sbs_example_4: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
sbs_example_5: atthi āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

meaning_1: Brahman; priest; man of the Brahman caste
example_1:
na jaccā vasalo hoti,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
kammunā vasalo hoti,
kammunā hoti brāhmaṇo'ti.
example_2: imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: yathā ca pana kāmehi visaṃyuttaṃ viharantaṃ taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ akathaṃkathiṃ chinnakukkuccaṃ bhav'ābhave vītataṇhaṃ saññā n'ānusenti
sbs_example_5: etaṃ bhagavatā bārāṇasiyaṃ isipatane migadāye anuttaraṃ dhammacakkaṃ pavattitaṃ appaṭivattiyaṃ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmin'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_5: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: ascetic; renunciant; holy man; monk; recluse; lit. who makes an effort; calm one
example_1: āsavānaṃ khayā samaṇo hoti.
example_2: etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ

sbs_example_4: evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti
sbs_example_5: ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabb'ete pañc'upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.

meaning_1: state of suffering; purgatory; underworld; lit. bad fall
example_1: m'āyaṃ āyasmā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjī'ti! evaṃ tasmiṃ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu?
sbs_example_3: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.

meaning_1: community; monastic order; assembly of monks
example_1: idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse saṅgho viharati sathero sapāmokkho. tassa me saṅghassa sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ, ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ satthusāsanan'ti.
example_2:
yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca,
saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato,
cattāri ariyasaccāni,
sammappaññāya passati.
sbs_example_3: kiñcāpi so hoti majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa sannisinno, atha kho so ārakāva saṅghamhā saṅgho ca tena.
sbs_example_4: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā antarā ca rājagahaṃ antarā ca nāḷandaṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi

example_1: bhavasaṃyojane ca kho appahīne bhavo'pi appahīno hotī'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.
example_2:
yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.
sbs_example_3:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
sbs_example_4: katamañ'ca dukkhasamudayaṃ ariyasaccaṃ? yāyaṃ taṇhā ponobbhavikā nandīrāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī. seyyath'idaṃ, kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā.
sbs_example_5: upādānanirodhā, bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā, jātinirodho, jātinirodhā, jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.

example_1: lobho akusalamūlaṃ doso akusalamūlaṃ moho akusalamūlaṃ idaṃ vuccat'āvuso akusalamūlaṃ.
example_2:
saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā,
paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā,
saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ,

meaning_1: (mental) suffering; distress; dissatisfaction; dejection; depression; grief
example_1: ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā

commentary: (MNa) aho nūna te so bhagavā satthā'ti sabrahmacārī tāva te evaṃmahiddhiko, so pana te bhagavā satthā aho nūna mahiddhiko'ti satthu iddhipāṭihāriyadassane jāt'ābhilāpā hutvā evam'āhaṃsu.
example_1: sabbalokā ca me mano vuṭṭhahissati, nibbāne ca santadassāvī bhavissāmi, anusayā ca me samugghātaṃ gacchissanti, kiccakārī ca bhavissāmi, satthā ca me pariciṇṇo bhavissati mettāvatāyā'ti.
example_2: yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mam'accayena satthā.
sbs_example_3: iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.
sbs_example_3: iti imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imass'uppādā idaṃ uppajjati. imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti, imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati
sbs_example_4: upādānanirodhā, bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā, jātinirodho, jātinirodhā, jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā nirujjhanti.
sbs_example_5: vuccati cittaṃ iti'pi, mano iti'pi, viññāṇaṃ iti'pi, taṃ rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññaṃ nirujjhati.

commentary: (NIDD1) naro'ti satto naro mānavo poso puggalo jīvo jāgu jantu indagu manujo.
example_1:
mātari pitari c'āpi,
yo micchā paṭipajjati,
tathāgate vā sambuddhe,
atha vā tassa sāvake,
bahuñ'ca so pasavati,
apuññaṃ tādiso naro.
example_2:
taṃ puttapasusammattaṃ,
byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
suttaṃ gāmaṃ mah'ogho'va,
maccu ādāya gacchati.
sbs_example_3: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
sbs_example_4:
yo appaduṭṭhassa narassa dussati, suddhassa posassa anaṅgaṇassa.
tam'eva bālaṃ pacceti pāpaṃ, sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ'va khitto.

meaning_1: fading of desire (for); dispassion (towards); detachment (from); indifference (to)
example_1:
maggān'aṭṭh'aṅgiko seṭṭho,
saccānaṃ caturo padā,
virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ,
dvipadānañ'ca cakkhumā.
example_2: nibbindaṃ virajjati, virāgā vimuccati, vimuttasmiṃ vimuttam'iti ñāṇaṃ hoti
sbs_example_3: ime dhammā virāgāya saṃvattanti, no sarāgāya, visaṃyogāya saṃvattanti, no saṃyogāya
sbs_example_4: evaṃ rūpassa nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.
sbs_example_5:
khayaṃ virāgaṃ amataṃ paṇītaṃ,

na tena dhammena sam'atthi kiñci

meaning_1: trainee; apprentice; learner: (comm) seven stages of a noble person before arahantship
commentary:
(SNPa) sekhā'ti, sīl'ādīni sikkhamānā avasesā ariyapuggalā.
(VINa) sekho'ti puthujjanakalyāṇakena saddhiṃ satta ariyā tisso sikkhā sikkhantī'ti sekhā.
example_1:
sekho pathaviṃ vicessati,
yamalokañ'ca imaṃ sadevakaṃ,
sekho dhammapadaṃ sudesitaṃ,
kusalo puppham'iva pacessati.
example_2:
ye ca saṅkhātadhammāse,
ye ca sekhā puthū idha,
tesaṃ me nipako iriyaṃ,
puṭṭho pabrūhi mārisa.
sbs_example_3: ime bhikkhave dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
sbs_example_4: kathañ'c'ānanda, sekho hoti pāṭipado?

example_1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti. katame aṭṭha?
example_2: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca
sbs_example_3: ime dhammā virāgāya saṃvattanti, no sarāgāya, visaṃyogāya saṃvattanti, no saṃyogāya

notes:
3 āsavā: 1. kāmāsava, 2. bhavāsava, 3. avijjāsava.
4. āsavā 1. kāmāsava, 2. bhavāsava, 3. diṭṭhāsava, 4 avijjāsava.
The list of four appears for the first time in Khuddakanikāya, then becomes the standard.
example_1:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ,
ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ,
atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

example_2: tena kho pana samayena satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā parūḷhakacchanakhalomā khārivividham'ādāya bhagavato avidūre atikkamanti.

example_1: tass'idaṃ, bhikkhave, manussattaṃ laddhaṃ, tathāgato loke uppanno arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, tathāgatappavedito ca dhammavinayo loke dibbati.
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.
sbs_example_3: uppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
sbs_example_4: buddho kira loke uppanno'ti. tāva'd'eva ca pana bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamitu'kāmo hoti.
sbs_example_5: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū uppannāya taṇhāya ponobhavikāya na vasaṃ gacchissanti, vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yesaṃ sambodhi'y'aṅgesu,
sammā cittaṃ subhāvitaṃ,
ādānapaṭinissagge,
anupādāya ye ratā,
khīṇ'āsavā jutimanto,
te loke parinibbutā.
example_2: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabba-upadhi-paṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānan'ti
sbs_example_3: paṭinissagg'ānupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, paṭinissagg'ānupassī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.
sbs_example_4: idaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ, yo tassā'y'eva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo.

example_1:
viññāṇassa nirodhena,
taṇhākkhayavimuttino,
pajjotass'eva nibbānaṃ,
vimokkho hoti cetaso'ti.
example_2: ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.
sbs_example_3: nirodha-anupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, nirodha-anupassī passasissāmī'ti sikkhati
sbs_example_4: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.

meaning_1: wearing away (of); exhaustion (of); erosion (of); depletion (of); slow destruction (of)
example_1:
yoniso manasikāro,
dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno,
n'atth'añño evaṃ bahukāro,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
yoniso padahaṃ bhikkhu,
khayaṃ dukkhassa pāpuṇe'ti.
example_2: tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesu'y'eva kusalesu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya uttari āsavānaṃ khayāya yogo karaṇīyo'ti.
sbs_example_3:
khayaṃ virāgaṃ amataṃ paṇītaṃ,
yad'ajjhagā sakyamunī samāhito.
na tena dhammena sam'atthi kiñci
sbs_example_4: jānato ahaṃ passato āsavānaṃ khayaṃ vadāmi, no ajānato no apassato. yoniso ca manasikāraṃ ayoniso ca manasikāraṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (item being named); it is so; thus; just like this
example_1: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samaṇo iti'pi brāhmaṇo iti'pi nhātako iti'pi vedagū iti'pi sottiyo iti'pi ariyo iti'pi arahaṃ iti'pi
example_2: api ca kho evaṃdiṭṭhikā ahesuṃ, sassato loko iti'pi, asassato loko iti'pi, antavā loko iti'pi, anantavā loko iti'pi, taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīraṃ iti'pi, aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīraṃ iti'pi, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā iti'pi, na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā iti'pi, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā iti'pi, n'eva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā iti'pi
sbs_example_3: iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā'ti
sbs_example_4: vuccati cittaṃ iti'pi, mano iti'pi, viññāṇaṃ iti'pi, taṃ rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññaṃ nirujjhati.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena theraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantehi, satthā taṃ, āvuso thera, āmantetī'ti.
example_2: tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati
sbs_example_3: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī.
sbs_example_4: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: ignorance; illusion; not knowing; not understanding
example_1: rūparāgo, arūparāgo, māno, uddhaccaṃ, avijjā, imāni pañc'uddham'bhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni.
example_2:
avijjāya nivuto loko,
vevicchā pamādā nappakāsati,
japp'ābhilepanaṃ brūmi,
dukkham'assa mahabbhayaṃ.
sbs_example_3: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷ'āyatanaṃ, saḷ'āyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā
sbs_example_4: avijjam'p'āhaṃ sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ. ko c'āhāro avijjāya? pañca nīvaraṇā'ti'ssa vacanīyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: avijjāya tv'eva asesavirāganirodhā, saṅkhāranirodho, saṅkhāranirodhā, viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā, nāmarūpanirodho, nāmarūpanirodhā

meaning_1: enlightened being; fourth stage of the path; lit. worthy one
example_1: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?

meaning_1: endowed with knowledge and conduct; accomplished in understanding and action; perfect in wisdom and moral conduct
commentary: (ANa) vijjācaraṇasampanno'ti tīhi vijjāhi ca pañcadasahi caraṇadhammehi ca samannāgato.
notes: see MN 53 Sekhasuttaṃ for a good definition of vijjācaraṇasampanno
example_1: iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā'ti.
example_2:
khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṃ,
ye gottapaṭisārino,

so seṭṭho devamānuse'ti.

meaning_1: sorrow and mourning; sadness and crying
example_1: acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yāvañ'c'idaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okās'ādhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.

meaning_1: walks; wanders; goes around; travels; fares on

meaning_1: room; inside room; inner chamber; lit. womb
example_1: nikkaḍḍheyyā'ti gabbhe gahetvā pamukhaṃ nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa. pamukhe gahetvā bahi nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa. ekena payogena bahuke'pi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

example_2:

example_1: akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahatha. sakkā, bhikkhave, akusalaṃ pajahituṃ. no c'etaṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa akusalaṃ pajahituṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahathā'ti.
example_2:
diṭṭhena ce suddhi narassa hoti,
ñāṇena vā so pajahāti dukkhaṃ,
aññena so sujjhati sopadhīko,
diṭṭhī hi naṃ pāva tathā vadānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: yo saṅkhāresu chandarāgo taṃ pajahatha. evaṃ te saṅkhārā pahīnā bhavissanti ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
sbs_example_4: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.
sbs_example_5: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.

meaning_1: shelter; refuge; help; lit. going to
example_1:
n'etaṃ kho saraṇaṃ khemaṃ,
n'etaṃ saraṇam'uttamaṃ,
n'etaṃ saraṇam'āgamma,
sabbadukkhā pamuccati.
example_2:
jaheyya sabbasaṃyogaṃ,
kareyya saraṇa-attano,
careyy'ādittasīso'va,
patthayaṃ accutaṃ padan'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca, saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato,
cattāri ariyasaccāni, sammappaññāya passati.

example_1: diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutto, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, na parimuccati dukkhasmā'ti vadāmi
example_2: satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: yañ'c'assa sārena sārakaraṇīyaṃ tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhavissati. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.

meaning_1: increases more and more; surpasses; outgrows
example_1: oḷārikassa'pi kho ahaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attapaṭilābhassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desemi, yathāpaṭipannānaṃ vo saṃkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti
example_2: yañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi.
sbs_example_3: yañ'ca khv'āssa, bhante, sīlabbataṃ jīvitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ upaṭṭhānasāraṃ sevato akusalā dhammā parihāyanti, kusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti
sbs_example_4:
uṭṭhānavato satīmato, sucikammassa nisammakārino,
saññatassa dhammajīvino, appamattassa yaso-abhivaḍḍhati.

meaning_1: name of the people of Malla; Mallans; lit. wrestlers
example_1: assosuṃ kho pāveyyakā mallā bhagavā kira kusinārāyaṃ parinibbuto'ti
example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā mallesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena thūṇaṃ nāma mallānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
sbs_example_3: yadā pana mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ suṇāma, kosalehi mallesu cārikaṃ pakkamissatī''ti, hoti no tasmiṃ samaye anattamanatā hoti domanassaṃ, dūre no bhagavā bhavissatī'ti.

meaning_1: name of the people of Kosala; Kosalans
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā bhikkhū, kosalesu viharanti himavantapasse araññakuṭikāya uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākat'indriyā.

example_1: evaṃ tasmiṃ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo. samantapāsādikaṃ, āvuso, puggalaṃ āgamma cittaṃ pasīdati.
example_2: katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhārahāro? puggalo tissa vacanīyaṃ. yv'āyaṃ āyasmā evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhārahāro.

example_1: atha kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya, paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ pāpuṇeyya, paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ vissajjeyya dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya.

example_1:
dukkhan'ti khandhe paṭipassa yoniso,
yato ca dukkhaṃ samudeti taṃ jaha,
idh'eva dukkhassa karohi antaṃ,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2:
so karohi dīpam'attano,
khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava,
niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo,
dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.

sbs_example_4: yaṃ te, ambho purisa, karaṇīyaṃ taṃ karohī'ti.

example_1: taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha. bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho therā bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
example_2:
rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā,
piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto,
sārattacitto vedeti,

meaning_1: name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great wisdom; lit. son of Sāri
commentary:
(MNa) sāriputto'ti ca pana manti sāriyā brāhmaṇiyā putto'ti ca pana evaṃ maṃ sabrahmacārī jānanti.
(AN 1.189) etad'aggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ mahāpaññānaṃ yad'idaṃ sāriputto.
example_1: āraddhavīriyo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vattā, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vacanakkhamo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. codako, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pāpagarahī, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.
example_2: evaṃ vutte, āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca, ko nāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? upatisso'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, sāriputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.
sbs_example_4: sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

meaning_1: name of the Buddha's attendant; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great learning, remembrance, conduct, resoluteness and service; lit. happiness

example_1: yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?

commentary: (SNa) daṇḍenā'ti catuhatthadaṇḍena vā khadiradaṇḍena vā ghaṭikamuggarena vā.
example_1:
sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa,
sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci pāṇinā pahāraṃ dadeyya, leḍḍunā pahāraṃ dadeyya, daṇḍena pahāraṃ dadeyya, satthena pahāraṃ dadeyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
sbs_example_3: nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī viharati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato
example_2: es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca.
sbs_example_3: na arahati bhavaṃ kūṭadanto samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṃ. samaṇo tv'eva gotamo arahati bhavantaṃ kūṭadantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṃ

example_1:
na ca katthitā siyā bhikkhu,
na ca vācaṃ payuttaṃ bhāseyya,
pāgabbhiyaṃ na sikkheyya,
kathaṃ viggāhikaṃ na kathayeyya.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
sbs_example_3:
manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā, manoseṭṭhā manomayā.
manasā ce paduṭṭhena, bhāsati vā karoti vā.
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti, cakkaṃ'va vahato padaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
evam'etaṃ mahāvīra, yathā samaṇa bhāsasi.
ettha c'eke visīdanti, paṅkamh'iva jaraggavo.
sbs_example_5: taṃ suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso
example_2:
cakkhūhi n'eva lol'assa,
gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,
rase ca n'ānugijjheyya,
na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: jivhā ādittā, rasā ādittā, jivhāviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, jivhāsamphasso āditto
sbs_example_4:
sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti, sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti, taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.
example_2: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
sbs_example_3: iti imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imass'uppādā idaṃ uppajjati. imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti, imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati
sbs_example_4: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti
sbs_example_5: āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, idaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan'ti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi
sbs_example_3: ime sakkāre duggatapaṇṇ'ākārabhūte paṭiggaṇhātu amhākaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, akusalaṃ pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati tasm'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahathā'ti.
example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.
sbs_example_3: ime dhammā virāgāya saṃvattanti, no sarāgāya, visaṃyogāya saṃvattanti, no saṃyogāya
sbs_example_4: ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati

Setting in Motion the Wheel of
Dhamma
sbs_example_5: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.

meaning_1: stilling (of); serenity (of); calming (of); settling (of); peace (of); (comm) mental unification
example_1:
kadā nu rūpe amite ca sadde,
gandhe rase phusitabbe ca dhamme,
ādittato'haṃ samathehi yutto,
paññāya dacchaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.
example_2: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānan'ti
sbs_example_3: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?
sbs_example_4: kālena dhammassavanaṃ, kālena dhammasākacchā, kālena samatho, kālena vipassanā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yathākathaṃ pana tvaṃ bhikkhu mayā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsī'ti
example_2: tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idān'eva pana mayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ evaṃ ājānāma, usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti. yathā kathaṃ pan'āvuso, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo'ti?

example_1: bhagavā etadavoca, bhadd'ekarattassa vo, bhikkhave, uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
example_2: tatra idaṃ nissāya idaṃ pajahatha, tayo satipaṭṭhānā yadariyo sevati yadariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yoggācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti, ayam'uddeso saḷ'āyatanavibhaṅgassa.
sbs_example_3: handa mayaṃ paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅgaṃ bhaṇāmase
sbs_example_4: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.
sbs_example_5: janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyāti, ayam'uddeso araṇavibhaṅgassa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.
example_2: ahaṃ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi. tvam'pi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū'ti.
sbs_example_3: handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu, bhuttāvī pavārito, anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: sappāyāni c'eva bhojanāni bhuñjeyyāsi, mā te asappāyāni bhojanāni bhuñjato vaṇo assāvī assa.

notes: refers to animals eating or humans chewing
example_1:
ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi yaṃ yad'eva hi sā gāvī niccammā nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye tan'nissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ. evam'eva khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, phass'āhāro daṭṭhabbo'ti
sbs_example_5: yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

example_1: siyā kho pana bhikkhave ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā pucchatha bhikkhave mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha
example_2:
anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
sbs_example_3: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti
sbs_example_4: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho. yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ (itthannāmaṃ) bhikkhuṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ, app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ, kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma, kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (of mental defilement) complete quenching; total emancipation; complete cooling; lit. blowing away
example_1:
ārogyaparamā lābhā,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ,
aṭṭh'aṅgiko ca maggānaṃ,
khemaṃ amatagāminan'ti.
example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, ariyā pariyesanā? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ... attanā byādhidhammo samāno byādhidhamme ādīnavaṃ viditvā abyādhiṃ anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ nibbānaṃ pariyesati
sbs_example_3: evam'eva kho, brāhmaṇa, tiṭṭhat'eva nibbānaṃ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, tiṭṭhām'ahaṃ samādapetā
sbs_example_4: ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
sbs_chant_eng_4:
Setting in Motion the Wheel of
Dhamma
sbs_example_5:
khantī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā, nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā,

meaning_1: bears in mind; keeps in mind; remembers; lit. carries
commentary: (SNa) upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretū'ti maṃ bhagavā, upāsako ayan'ti evaṃ dhāretu, jānātū'ti attho.
example_1: maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajja't'agge pāṇ'upetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ek'aṃsena, gotami, dhāreyyāsi, eso dhammo, eso vinayo, etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti

sbs_example_5: idha saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati,
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: young man; young gentleman; young Brahman
example_1:
tassa taṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ,
satthāni nikkhipitvāna,
māṇavā etadabravuṃ.
example_2: bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti
sbs_example_3:
dumapphalānī'va patanti māṇavā, daharā ca vuḍḍhā ca sarīrabhedā.
etam'pi disvā pabbajito'mhi rāja, apaṇṇakaṃ sāmaññam'eva seyyo.

meaning_1: proposition; synopsis; statement in brief; summary; introduction; lit. pointing up
example_1: yaṃ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṃkhittena uddesaṃ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṃ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā vihāraṃ paviṭṭho
example_2: ataramāno'va bhāseyya, no taramāno. janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, ayam'uddeso araṇavibhaṅgassa.

example_1: lobhassa ca pahānāya dosassa ca pahānāya atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati

example_2: ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

meaning_1: fills up; fills out; lit. causes to fill
commentary: (DNa) abhisandetī'ti temeti sneheti, sabbattha pavattapītisukhaṃ karoti. parisandetī'ti samantato sandeti. paripūretī'ti vāyunā bhastaṃ viya pūreti. parippharatī'ti samantato phusati.
example_1: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti
example_2:
ye keci buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatāse,
na te gamissanti apāyabhūmiṃ,
pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
devakāyaṃ paripūressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.

example_1:
devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.
example_2: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.
sbs_example_3: asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ
sbs_example_4:
gāme vā yadi v'āraññe, ninne vā yadi vā thale.
yattha arahanto viharanti, taṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakan'ti.
sbs_example_5: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubb'ārāme migāramātupāsāde. atha kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya,
eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
sbs_example_3: appiyehi sampayogo dukkho, piyehi vippayogo dukkho, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?
sbs_example_5: atthi ca me uttariṃ avasiṭṭhaṃ dārabharaṇāyā'ti. so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ.

sbs_meaning: disciplinary code; precepts; training rules; lit. leading to freedom
commentary: (KV) tattha pātimokkhanti paatimokkhaṃ atipamokkhaṃ atiseṭṭhaṃ atiuttamanti attho.
example_1: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlavā hohi pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi
example_2:
akittayī vivaṭacakkhu,
sakkhidhammaṃ parissayavinayaṃ,
paṭipadaṃ vadehi bhaddante,
pātimokkhaṃ athavā'pi samādhiṃ.
sbs_example_3:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

meaning_1: in that regard; in that case; regarding that matter
example_1: so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati
example_2: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, upādāniyo dhammo, yo tattha chandarāgo, taṃ tattha upādānaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tattha katame avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā? puññ'ābhisaṅkhāro, apuññ'ābhisaṅkhāro, āneñj'ābhisaṅkhāro, kāyasaṅkhāro, vacīsaṅkhāro, cittasaṅkhāro.
sbs_example_4: so tattha ṭhito āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti
sbs_example_5:
ye me pubbe viyākaṃsu, huraṃ gotamasāsanā,
icc'āsi iti bhavissati, sabbaṃ taṃ itihītihaṃ,
sabbaṃ taṃ takkavaḍḍhanaṃ, n'āhaṃ tattha abhiramiṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: it is good (for); it would be good (if)
example_1:
na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu,
yaṃ katvā anutappati,
yassa assumukho rodaṃ,
vipākaṃ paṭisevati.
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
sbs_example_3: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
sbs_example_4: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.
sbs_example_5: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto'pi pacchimājanat'ānukampamānasā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ, saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya, eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.
example_2:
rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti.
ūnā'va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h'atthi titti.
sbs_example_3: rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca,
saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato,
cattāri ariyasaccāni,
sammappaññāya passati.
example_2: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: passatha no tumhe, ānanda, taṃ vacanapathaṃ aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
sbs_example_4: sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, manussānaṃ ca amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: born from seclusion; (or) born from discrimination
example_1: abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ pitu sakkassa kamm'ante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharitā.
example_2: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: control (according to); restraint (according to); holding back (according to)
example_1:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.
example_2: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ.
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_2:
sabbe saddhammagaruno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca.
athā'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (DHPa) sabbe pana gandharas'ādayo'pi rasā ukkaṃsato devatānaṃ sudhābhojanaraso'pi saṃsāravaṭṭe pātetvā dukkh'ānubhavanas'seva paccayo. yo panesa sattatiṃsa-bodhipakkhiyadhamma-saṅkhāto ca navalokuttaradhamma-saṅkhāto ca dhammaraso, ayam'eva sabbarasānaṃ seṭṭho. tena vuttaṃ, sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jinātī'ti.
example_1:
sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: delight and ease; joy and happiness
example_1: abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ pitu sakkassa kamm'ante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharitā.
example_2: bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
passa cittakataṃ bimbaṃ,
arukāyaṃ samussitaṃ,
āturaṃ bahusaṅkappaṃ,
yassa n'atthi dhuvaṃ ṭhiti.
example_2:
yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
et'ādiso vinābhāvo,
passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: way; nature; habit; property; quality; lit. going around
example_1:
yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
et'ādiso vinābhāvo,
passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.
example_2:
lesakappe pariyāye, parikappe'nudhāvitā.
jīvik'atthā upāyena, saṅkaḍḍhanti bahuṃ dhanaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya, uṇhassa paṭighātāya, ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya, yāva'd'eva hirikopīnappaṭicchādanatthaṃ

meaning_1: taste of the Dhamma; flavour of the Dhamma
example_1:
sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

example_1:
yāya devā manussā ca,
sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti,
nirayamhi samappitā.
example_2:
yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'c'āpi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

meaning_1: name of a monk; lit. protector of the fire
example_1: rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,

sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.
