example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.2) coro nāma yo pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati. eso coro nāma.
example_1:
dinnaṃ sukhaphalaṃ hoti,
n'ādinnaṃ hoti taṃ tathā,
corā haranti rājāno,
aggi ḍahati nassati.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.
sbs_example_3: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya, yathārūpe adinn'ādāne rājāno coraṃ gahetvā haneyyuṃ vā bandheyyuṃ vā pabbājeyyuṃ vā
sbs_example_4:
coro ahaṃ pure āsiṃ, aṅgulimālo'ti vissuto.
vuyhamāno mah'oghena, buddhaṃ saraṇam'āgamaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kathañ'c'ānanda appaṇidhāya bhāvanā hoti?
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti, upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3:
ye puggalā aṭṭha sataṃ pasatthā, cattāri etāni yugāni honti.
te dakkhiṇeyyā sugatassa sāvakā, etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni.
sbs_example_4:
kassako kammunā hoti, sippiko hoti kammunā.
vāṇijo kammunā hoti, pessako hoti kammunā.
sbs_example_5:
na jaccā vasalo hoti, na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo.
kammunā vasalo hoti, kammunā hoti brāhmaṇo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: desire (for); passion (for); infatuation (with); lust (for); lit. attachment
commentary: (SNa) rāgo'tiādīni lobhass'eva nāmāni. so hi rañjanavasena rāgo, nandanavasena nandī, taṇhāyanavasena taṇhā'ti vuccati.
example_1: kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ. yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.
example_2:
aññaṃ ito y'ābhivadanti dhammaṃ,
aparaddhā suddhim'akevalī te,
evam'pi titthyā puthuso vadanti,
sandiṭṭhirāgena hi te'bhirattā.
sbs_example_3: yāyaṃ taṇhā ponobbhavikā nandirāgasahagatā tatratatr'ābhinandinī seyyath'īdaṃ kāmataṇhā bhavataṇhā vibhavataṇhā
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi
sbs_example_5: anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā, rāgassa abhiññāya ime dasa dhammā bhāvetabbā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.
example_2: pañcahi, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhīhi vaḍḍhamānā ariyasāvikā ariyāya vaḍḍhiyā vaḍḍhati sār'ādāyinī ca hoti var'ādāyinī ca kāyassa. katamehi pañcahi?
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
sbs_example_5: ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañc'aṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha bhikkhu ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, ahu vata me, taṃ vata me n'atthi, siyā vata me, taṃ vat'āhaṃ na labhāmī'ti.
example_2: ahu kho so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ ānakassa mudiṅgassa porāṇaṃ pokkharaphalakaṃ antaradhāyi, āṇisaṅghāṭo'va avasissi.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi, pacchā te mā-ahu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi, upasanto carissasi.
sbs_example_4:
samaṇassa ahu cintā,
pupphitamhi mahāvane,
ekaggassa nisinnassa,
pavivittassa jhāyino.
sbs_example_5:
tassa me ahu ussāho, nibbānaṃ abhipassato.
nā'haṃ bhabbo eta'r'ahi, kāmāni paṭisevituṃ.
anivatti bhavissāmi, brahmacariyaparāyaṇo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atthi, bhikkhave, ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ
example_2:
paccati munino bhattaṃ,
thokaṃ thokaṃ kule kule,
piṇḍikāya carissāmi,
atthi jaṅghābalaṃ mamā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena
sbs_example_4: atthi kāyo'ti vā pana'ssa sati paccupaṭṭhitā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: yaṃ kho bhikkhave dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi.
sbs_example_4: samudayadhamm'ānupassī vā kāyasmiṃ viharati, vayadhamm'ānupassī vā kāyasmiṃ viharati, samudayavayadhamm'ānupassī vā kāyasmiṃ viharati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: perfect peace of mind; stability of mind; stillness of mind; mental composure
example_1:
asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.
example_2: saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ vossagg'ārammaṇaṃ karitvā labhissati samādhiṃ, labhissati cittassa ekaggataṃ.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ buddhaseṭṭho parivaṇṇayī suciṃ,
samādhim'ānantarikañ'ñam'āhu.
samādhinā tena samo na vijjati
sbs_example_4: ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañc'aṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_5: yathā ca anuppannassa samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa uppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti, yathā ca uppannassa samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūrī hoti tañ'ca pajānāti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.
example_2: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandun'ti.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4: niṭṭham'ettha gantabbaṃ – addhā, idaṃ na c'eva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
sbs_example_5: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamano āyasmā rāhulo bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: developing; cultivating; meditating; lit. causing to be
example_1: disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.
example_2:
dullabhaṃ v'āpi labhanti,
cittavūpasame ratā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
bhāvanāya rato mano'ti.
sbs_example_3: uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati
sbs_example_4: ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañc'aṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā kumbhakār'āvesanaṃ pavisitvā ekam'antaṃ tiṇasanthārakaṃ paññāpetvā nisīdi pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena kasibhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa parivesanā vattati. atha kho bhagavā yena parivesanā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tatra'pi evaṃ aṭṭhāsiṃ evaṃ nisīdiṃ evaṃ abhāsiṃ evaṃ tuṇhī ahosiṃ
example_2: sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami divāvihārāya. andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ supupphitasālarukkhamūle aṭṭhāsi.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto accho vippasanno anāvilo āloke nikkhitto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ jāneyya passeyya.
example_2: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
sbs_example_3: thinamiddhaṃ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṃ parisodheti
sbs_example_4: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan'ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
sbs_chant_eng_4: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_5: ālokasaññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi – yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā. iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sa'p'pabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveyyāsi

meaning_1: delighted (in); was pleased (with); approved (of); was happy (with); relished
example_1: attamano āyasmā rāhulo bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandi
example_2: atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.
sbs_example_3: idam'avoca bhagavā. attamanā pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanduṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭho-asi bhagavatā, n'atthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāso'ti
example_2:
atthakāmo'si me yakkha,
hitakāmo'si devate,
karomi tuyhaṃ vacanaṃ,
tvaṃ'si ācariyo mama.
sbs_example_3:
gahakāraka diṭṭho-asi, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam'ajjhagā.
sbs_example_4:
mutt'āhaṃ sabbapāsehi, ye dibbā ye ca mānusā.
mahābandhanamutto'mhi, nihato tvam'asi antakā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
example_2: atha kho therā bhikkhū yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy'antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.
sbs_example_4: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi. sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: is dis-enchanted (with); is disinterested (in); is disillusioned (by); loses interest (in); is dispassionate (towards)
example_1: yaṃ kiñci pasavati, asuci'y'eva pasavati, duggandhaṃ'y'eva pasavati, jegucchiyaṃ'y'eva pasavati. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ kāye nibbindathā'ti.
example_2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
sbs_example_3: evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako rūpasmim'pi nibbindati, vedanāya'pi nibbindati, saññāya'pi nibbindati, saṅkhāresu'pi nibbindati, viññāṇasmim'pi nibbindati.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, na dān'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ito paraṃ uposathaṃ karissāmi, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissāmi
example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca
sbs_chant_eng_2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_3: evaṃ me sutaṃ ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
es'eva maggo n'atth'añño,
dassanassa visuddhiyā,
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha,
mārass'etaṃ pamohanaṃ.
example_2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
sbs_example_3: ek'āyano ayaṃ maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā, sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya, dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya, ñāyassa adhigamāya, nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yad'idaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) dhajo rathassā'ti mahantasmiṃ hi saṅgāmasīse dūrato'va dhajaṃ disvā, asukarañño nāma ayaṃ ratho'ti ratho pākaṭo hoti.
example_1:
bhāsaye jotaye dhammaṃ,
paggaṇhe isinaṃ dhajaṃ,
subhāsitadhajā isayo,
dhammo hi isinaṃ dhajo'ti.
example_2:
dhajo rathassa paññāṇaṃ,
dhūmo paññāṇam'aggino,
rājā raṭṭhassa paññāṇaṃ,
bhattā paññāṇam'itthiyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: dhammo dhajo yo viya tassa satthu dassesi lokassa visuddhimaggaṃ, niyyāniko dhammadharassa dhārī sāt'āvaho santikaro suciṇṇo
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kumbhakāro pure āsiṃ,
vekaḷiṅge ghaṭīkaro,
mātāpettibharo āsiṃ,
kassapassa upāsako.
example_2:
vanacārī pure āsiṃ,
satataṃ vanakammiko,
patth'odanaṃ gahetvāna,
kamm'antaṃ agamās'ahaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
coro ahaṃ pure āsiṃ, aṅgulimālo'ti vissuto.
vuyhamāno mah'oghena, buddhaṃ saraṇam'āgamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: amutra-asiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
migaluddo pure āsiṃ,
araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ,
tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.
example_2:
icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā,
te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure v'āpi apekkhamānā,
ime'va kāme purime'va jappaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
coro ahaṃ pure āsiṃ, aṅgulimālo'ti vissuto.
vuyhamāno mah'oghena, buddhaṃ saraṇam'āgamaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, majjhe nadiyā soto vikkhitto visaṭo byādiṇṇo n'eva dūraṅ'gamo assa na sīghasoto na hārahārī .
example_2:
savanti sabbadhi sotā,
sotānaṃ kiṃ nivāraṇaṃ,
sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūhi,
kena sotā pidhiyyare.
sbs_example_3:
chinda sotaṃ parakkamma, kāme panūda brāhmaṇa.
nappahāya munī kāme, n'ekattam'upapajjati.
sbs_example_4: abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: may they be!; they must be!
example_1: abyāpannacitto hoti appaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo ime sattā averā hontu abyāpajjā anīghā sukhī attānaṃ pariharantū'ti
example_2: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_3: brahmamārā ca indā ca lokapālā ca devatā, yamo, mittā manussā ca majjhattā verikā'pi ca, sabbe sattā sukhī hontu.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kadā nu paññāmayam'uggatejaṃ,
satthaṃ isīnaṃ sahas'ādiyitvā,
māraṃ sasenaṃ sahasā bhañjissaṃ,
sīh'āsane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2: bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhante, rohitasso nāma isi ahosiṃ bhojaputto iddhimā vehāsaṅ'gamo.
sbs_example_3:
bhāsaye jotaye dhammaṃ, paggaṇhe isinaṃ dhajaṃ,
subhāsitadhajā isayo, dhammo hi isinaṃ dhajo'ti.
sbs_example_4:
idaṃ vatvā sālavane, samaṇo bhāvit'indriyo.
brāhmaṇo parinibbāyī, isi khīṇapunabbhavo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: is reborn (in); re-arises (in); lit. goes towards
example_1:
atha v'āssa agārāni,
aggi ḍahati pāvako,
kāyassa bhedā duppañño,
nirayaṃ so-upapajjati.
example_2: yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?
sbs_example_3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_4: sace kho pana atthi paro loko, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, ath'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: katamo c'ānanda maggo katamā paṭipadā pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ pahānāya
example_2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.
sbs_example_3: ayam'eva ariyo aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo seyyath'īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.
example_2:
yāni sotāni lokasmiṃ,
sati tesaṃ nivāraṇaṃ,
sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūmi,
paññāy'ete pidhiyyare.
sbs_example_3: atthi kāyo'ti vā pana'ssa sati paccupaṭṭhitā hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: homeless spiritual seeker; wandering ascetic; lit. who goes around
commentary: (VIN 2.5.5.1) paribbājako nāma bhikkhuñ'ca sāmaṇerañ'ca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
example_1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti
example_2: sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, kiṃmūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, kiṃsambhavā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamudayā sabbe dhammā, kiṃsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā
sbs_example_3: atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: approached; drew near; went (to); lit. went near
example_1: atha kho āyasmā ānando pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya yena aññataro bhikkhun'upassayo tena-upasaṅkami
example_2: kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tena-upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
sbs_example_3: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tena-upasaṅkami
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro
example_2: imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.
sbs_example_3: atha kho āyasmā tisso bhagavato pitucchāputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n'eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam'eva alattha
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.
example_2: evaṃ vutte, bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi
sbs_example_3: asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī
sbs_example_4: tatra'pi evaṃ aṭṭhāsiṃ evaṃ nisīdiṃ evaṃ abhāsiṃ evaṃ tuṇhī ahosiṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yā me kaṅkhā pure āsi,
taṃ me byākāsi cakkhumā,
addhā munī'si sambuddho,
n'atthi nīvaraṇā tava.
example_2: ahaṃ kho pubbe ābādhiko ahosiṃ dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca me nacchādesi, na ca me āsi kāye balamattā
sbs_example_3:
aññathā lokanāthamhi, tiṭṭhante puris'uttame.
iriyaṃ āsi bhikkhūnaṃ, aññathā dāni dissati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: it is suitable (for); it is proper (for); it is fitting (for); it is allowable
example_1: kappati samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ jātarūparajataṃ, sādiyanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, paṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajatan'ti!
example_2: sappi nāma gosappi vā ajikāsappi vā mahiṃsasappi vā yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati tesaṃ sappi.
sbs_example_3: alaṃ, āvuso, mā socittha, mā paridevittha, sumuttā mayaṃ tena mahāsamaṇena. upaddutā ca homa, idaṃ vo kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kadā aniccaṃ vadharoganīḷaṃ,
kāyaṃ imaṃ maccujarāy'upaddutaṃ,
vipassamāno vītabhayo vihassaṃ,
eko vane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2:
nagā samuddā saritā vasun'dharā,
disā catasso vidisā adho divā,
sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutā,
kuhiṃ gato citta sukhaṃ ramissasi.
sbs_example_3: alaṃ, āvuso, mā socittha, mā paridevittha, sumuttā mayaṃ tena mahāsamaṇena. upaddutā ca homa, idaṃ vo kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī'ti.

example_1:
abhivādanasīlissa,
niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti,
āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.
example_2: etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.
sbs_example_3: ahaṃ kho pubbe ābādhiko ahosiṃ dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca me nacchādesi, na ca me āsi kāye balamattā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, dīgharattam'idaṃ cittaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā'ti. cittasaṃkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṃkilissanti. cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.
example_2:
kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti.

example_2: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, bhikkhavo'ti. bhadante'ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca

example_1:

imaṃ lokaṃ avekkhati,
tam'pi pāṇadadiṃ santiṃ,
hanti kuddho puthujjano.
example_2: santi idh'ekacce khattiyā, brāhmaṇā'ti bhaṇati
sbs_example_3: santi, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.

example_1:
gahakāraka diṭṭho'si,
puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā,
gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,

vanato jāyate bhayaṃ,
chetvā vanañ'ca vanathañ'ca,
nibbanā hotha bhikkhavo.

sbs_example_3:

nappahāya munī kāme, n'ekattam'upapajjati.

example_2: daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ
sbs_example_3: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

taṃ ve pasahati māro,

example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathaviyā lekhā khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, na ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho na dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
sbs_example_3:
yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo.
tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
sbs_example_4: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā yāguyā. katame pañca? khuddaṃ paṭihanati, pipāsaṃ paṭivineti, vātaṃ anulometi, vatthiṃ sodheti, ām'āvasesaṃ pāceti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā yāguyā'ti.
sbs_example_5:
sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca khudaṃ pipāsaṃ, vāt'ātape ḍaṃsasarīsape ca.
sabbāni'p'etāni abhisambhavitvā, eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
migo yathā seri sucittakānane,
rammaṃ giriṃ pāvus'ābbhamāliniṃ,
anākule tattha nage ramissaṃ,
asaṃsayaṃ citta parābhavissasi.
example_2: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati suṃsumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye
sbs_example_3: yassa passena migo palāyati, tass'eva gīvā'ti

example_1:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā,
sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇ'attho, bhante'ti.
sbs_example_3: yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno.

example_1:
viññāṇassa nirodhena,
taṇhākkhayavimuttino,
pajjotass'eva nibbānaṃ,
vimokkho hoti cetaso'ti.
example_2:
yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti,
taṇhā yassa na vijjati,
kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo,
vimokkho tassa n'āparo.
sbs_example_3:
yass'āsavā parikkhīṇā, āhāre ca anissito,
suññato animitto ca, vimokkho yassa gocaro,
ākāse va sakuntānaṃ, padaṃ tassa durannayaṃ.
sbs_example_4: channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā anupādā vimokkho.

example_1:
na vedanaṃ vedayati sapañño,
sukham'pi dukkham'pi bahussuto'pi,
ayañ'ca dhīrassa puthujjanena,
mahā viseso kusalassa hoti.
example_2: idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṃ vā, yadidaṃ dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṃ, anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin'ti?
sbs_example_3: yañ'ca khv'assa tatra sappi vā telaṃ vā taṃ uddhagāmi assa visesagāmi.

meaning_1: home (of); dwelling (of); abode (of); lit. resting place
example_1:
chando nidānaṃ gāthānaṃ,
akkharā tāsaṃ viyañjanaṃ,
nāmasannissitā gāthā,
kavi gāthānam'āsayo'ti.
example_2: yaṃnūna mayaṃ amuṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ nevāpikassa upanissāya āsayaṃ kappeyyāma.
sbs_example_3: yaṃnūna mayaṃ imaṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ mahatīhi daṇḍavākarāhi samantā sappadesaṃ anuparivāreyyāma, app'eva nāma tatiyānaṃ migajātānaṃ āsayaṃ passeyyāma, yattha te gāhaṃ gaccheyyun'ti.
sbs_example_4:
dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacaraṃ, asarīraṃ guha-asayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti, mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

example_1: atthi nu kho bhante kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati
example_2:
gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.
sbs_example_3: yaṃ pan'āniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ, etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti?
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

example_1:
āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,
uḷārā apar'āparā.
example_2: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.
sbs_example_3:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā, saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena
sbs_example_4:
sīlaṃ rakkheyya medhāvī,
patthayāno tayo sukhe,
pasaṃsaṃ vittalābhañ'ca,
pecca sagge pamodanaṃ.

example_1:
māse māse kus'aggena,
bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ,
kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ṭhite majjh'anhike kāle marīcikā phandati.
sbs_example_3: vanappagumbe yathā phussit'agge, gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi, nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

meaning_1: (any sharp pointed object which causes pain) arrow; spike; dagger; dart; barb
example_1:
pamādo rajo pamādo,
pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya,
abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
example_2: ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evam'assa, taṇhā kho sallaṃ samaṇena vuttaṃ, avijjāvisadoso, chandarāgabyāpādena ruppati.
sbs_example_3:
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha, ko attho supitena vo,
āturānañ'hi kā niddā, sallaviddhāna ruppataṃ.
sbs_example_4: maññitaṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, maññitaṃ gaṇḍo, maññitaṃ sallaṃ. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, amaññamānena cetasā viharissāmā'ti, evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

example_1:
kiṃ'su chetvā sukhaṃ seti,
kiṃ'su chetvā na socati,
kissa'ssu ekadhammassa,
vadhaṃ rocesi gotamā'ti.
example_2: vadho h'eso, kesi, ariyassa vinaye, yaṃ na tathāgato vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññati, n'āpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.

meaning_1: effort; exertion; undertaking; task; lit. yoking
example_1:
ayoge yuñjam'attānaṃ,
yogasmiñ'ca ayojayaṃ,
atthaṃ hitvā piyaggāhī,
pihet'att'ānuyoginaṃ.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, idaṃ dukkhan'ti yogo karaṇīyo, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yogo karaṇīyo, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yogo karaṇīyo, ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti yogo karaṇīyo'ti.

example_1:
kadā nu maṃ pāvusakālamegho,
navena toyena sacīvaraṃ vane,
isippayātamhi pathe vajantaṃ,
ovassate taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
example_2: na uppathena gacchanto pathena gacchantassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
sbs_example_3: ukkhittakhaggamatihatthasudāruṇan'taṃ, dhāvan'tiyojanapath'aṅgulimālavantaṃ. iddhī'bhisaṅkhatamano jitavā mun'indo.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi rañño paccantime nagare anupariyāyapatho hoti ucco c'eva vitthato ca, evam'evaṃ kho, ariyasāvako ottappī hoti, ottappati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena
sbs_example_5: seyyathā'pi dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa.

meaning_1: turn; detour; roundabout way; lit. going around
example_1: etu kho, bhante, bhagavā. svāgataṃ, bhante, bhagavato. cirassaṃ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi, yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya
example_2: ehi kho, mārisa, svāgataṃ, mārisa! cirassaṃ kho, mārisa, imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya.
sbs_example_3: tividh'āhaṃ kammānaṃ vipākaṃ vadāmi, diṭṭh'eva dhamme, upapajjaṃ vā, apare vā pariyāye. ayaṃ vuccati kammānaṃ vipāko.

example_1: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno ālindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi. āyasmā'pi kho soṇo bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
sbs_example_3:
tiṭṭhañ'caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat'assa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam'etaṃ vihāraṃ idha'm'āhu.
sbs_example_4: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: yaṃ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṃkhittena uddesaṃ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṃ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā vihāraṃ paviṭṭho
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṃ samaṇadosānaṃ samaṇakasaṭānaṃ āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānaṃ duggativedaniyānaṃ appahānā, na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno'ti vadāmi.
example_2: pañcadosavivajjitan'ti, pañc'ime caṅkamadosā nāma, thaddhavisamatā, antorukkhatā, gahanacchannatā, atisambādhatā, ativisālatā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
tiṇadosāni khettāni, rāgadosā ayaṃ pajā,

meaning_1: function; activity; process; lit. making together
example_1: passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmī'ti sikkhati, passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī'ti sikkhati.
example_2: yv'āyaṃ, āvuso, mato kālaṅ'kato tassa kāyasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, vacīsaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, cittasaṅkhārā niruddhā paṭippassaddhā, āyu parikkhīṇo, usmā vūpasantā, indriyāni paribhinnāni.
sbs_example_3: tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ vitakkasaṅkhārasaṇṭhānaṃ manasikaroto ye pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi te pahīyanti

example_1:
yathā'pi bhamaro pupphaṃ,
vaṇṇagandham'aheṭhayaṃ,
paleti rasam'ādāya,
evaṃ gāme munī care.
example_2:
pavivekarasaṃ pitvā,
rasaṃ upasamassa ca,
niddaro hoti nippāpo,
dhammapītirasaṃ pivaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tesaṃ rasapathaviṃ aṅguliyā sāyataṃ acchādesi, taṇhā ca tesaṃ okkami.

example_1: ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso
example_2: nārado sabbaṃ taṃ pavattiṃ ācikkhitvā iminā kāraṇena ahaṃ iminā abhisapito, ath'āhaṃ, mayhaṃ doso n'atthi, yassa doso atthi, tass'eva upari abhisapo patatū'ti vatvā abhisapiṃ
sbs_example_3: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā, amūlakañ'c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: ayaṃ varāko kiñ'c'āpi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.
example_2: cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi gihibhogā ca parihīno, sāmaññ'atthañ'ca na paripūreti.

commentary: (SNa) kena vaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti kena kāraṇena chavivaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti pucchati.
example_1:
tassa te n'atthi bhītattaṃ,
bhiyyo vaṇṇo pasīdati,
kasmā na paridevesi,
evarūpe mahabbhaye.
example_2:
araññe viharantānaṃ,
santānaṃ brahmacārinaṃ,
ekabhattaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ,
kena vaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tassa na tādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.
sbs_example_4: tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati, asammūḷho kālaṃ karoti

meaning_1: fault; offence; transgression; lit. going beyond
example_1: taggha taṃ, bhikkhu, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo tvaṃ sāriputtaṃ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhi
example_2: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṁvarāyāti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
aniccaṃ dukkhan'ti vipassa yoniso,
suññaṃ anattā'ti aghaṃ vadhan'ti ca,
manovicāre uparundha cetaso,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2:
akkosaṃ vadhabandhañ'ca,
aduṭṭho yo titikkhati,
khantībalaṃ bal'ānīkaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kissa hetu? passati hi so, bhikkhave, gopālako tatonidānaṃ vadhaṃ vā bandhanaṃ vā jāniṃ vā garahaṃ vā.
sbs_example_4: yesaṃ me manussānaṃ vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā uppajjeyyuṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā, atthi me tesu chandarāgo.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa na tādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na tādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.
example_2: tatra, bhikkhave, taramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi kilamati, cittam'pi upahaññati, saro'pi upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi āturīyati, avisaṭṭham'pi hoti aviññeyyaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, kusalo tvaṃ pubbe agāriyabhūto vīṇāya tantissare'ti?

example_1:
vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso araññe pavane caramāno passeyya purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇ'añjasaṃ pubbakehi manussehi anuyātaṃ.
sbs_example_3: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.

example_1:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ,
ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ,
atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.
example_2:
accī yathā vātavegena khittā,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ,
evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.

example_1: andho hi, uttara, cakkhunā rūpaṃ na passati, badhiro sotena saddaṃ na suṇātī'ti
example_2: sotena saddaṃ sutvā piyarūpe sadde adhimuccati, appiyarūpe sadde byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

sbs_example_4: cātummahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ saddaṃ sutvā tāvatiṃsā devā saddam'anussāvesuṃ

example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya
example_2: pañc'imāni, bhikkhave, bījajātāni. katamāni pañca? mūlabījaṃ, khandhabījaṃ, aggabījaṃ, phalubījaṃ, bījabījaññ'eva pañcamaṃ.

example_1: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca na ca sammā upeti kammāya.
example_2: tassa attano ca tāsañ'ca devatānaṃ saddhañ'ca sīlañ'ca sutañ'ca cāgañ'ca paññañ'ca anussarato cittaṃ pasīdati, pāmojjaṃ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
sbs_example_3: so ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe

example_1:
yo ve kiñcikkhakamyatā,

example_2:
santi loke munayo,
janā vadanti ta'y'idaṃ kathaṃsu,

sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yaṃ imasmiṃ jetavane tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ taṃ jano hareyya vā ḍaheyya vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kareyya.
sbs_example_4: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ osadhitārakā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante taṃ udakaṃ yathāninnaṃ pavattamānaṃ pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūreti.

example_1:
devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,

n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.
example_2:

example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm'eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya
example_2: yañ'c'assa sārena sārakaraṇīyaṃ tañ'c'assa atthaṃ anubhavissatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sār'atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno tiṇhaṃ kuṭhāriṃ ādāya vanaṃ paviseyya.

example_1:

example_1: imesaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, dasannaṃ kathāvatthūnaṃ upādāy'upādāya kathaṃ katheyyātha, imesam'pi candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃmah'ānubhāvānaṃ tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānan'ti!
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi vā panānanda, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ sūriye uggacchante, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, andhakāro antaradhāyissati, āloko pātubhavissatī'ti?
sbs_example_4: yathā ca, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa javo yathā ca candimasūriyānaṃ javo yathā ca yā devatā candimasūriyānaṃ purato dhāvanti tāsaṃ devatānaṃ javo

example_1:

aññam'aññehi byāruddhe,

example_2:
pūtimacchaṃ kus'aggena,

example_1:

vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ iminā saṃkhittena ovādena ovaditvā pakkāmi. atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi gāvī taruṇavacchā thambañ'ca ālumpati vacchakañ'ca apacinati. evam'eva kho dhammatā esā diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa

meaning_1: town; market town; lit. going down
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammaṃ nāma kurūnaṃ nigamo
example_2: seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sakamhā gāmā vā nigamā vā ciravippavuttho assa.

example_1:
yo n'ājjhagamā bhavesu sāraṃ,

so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

notes: (PED) very frequent as in comp, where it is sometimes pleonastic, and acts in the function of an abstract formation in˚tā or ˚ttaṃ
example_1:
yo ca papañcaṃ hitvāna,

yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.
example_2:
kodho mosavajjañ'ca kathaṃkathā ca,

ñatvā pavuttā samaṇena dhammā.

example_1: etha tumhe, āvuso, āraññikā hotha, araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevathā'ti, iti kāyavūpakāse samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso āraññiko hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi āraññiko ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na āraññikā'ti. so tena āraññikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.
sbs_example_3: sambahulā bhikkhū santhatāni ujjhitvā āraññik'aṅgaṃ piṇḍapātik'aṅgaṃ paṃsukūlik'aṅgaṃ samādiyiṃsu

example_1: gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati, ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñ'ca amukasmiñ'ca padese cariṃsu
example_2: yasmiṃ c'assā padese ṭhitāya evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti tañ'ca padesaṃ na sotthinā paccāgaccheyya.

example_1: na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhan'atthaṃ, na janalapan'atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti
example_2:
vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke,

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.
example_2: kiṃ nu kho me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva nu kho ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti udāhu asantaṃ udāhu mayham'ev'ete kammantā susaṃvihitā yena me ayyā santaṃ'y'eva ajjhattaṃ kopaṃ na pātukaroti, no asantaṃ?
sbs_example_3: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti

example_1: yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ, tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.
example_2: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc'eva akkhātaṃ sabbeh'eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo
sbs_example_3: sabbehi me piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo
sbs_example_4: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.

example_1:
anicce niccasaññino,
dukkhe ca sukhasaññino,
anattani ca attā'ti,
asubhe subhasaññino,
micchādiṭṭhihatā sattā,
khittacittā visaññino.
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussesu paccājāyanti. atha kho ete'y'eva bahutarā sattā ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti.
sbs_example_3:

example_1:

idha hem'antagimhisu,
iti bālo vicinteti,
antarāyaṃ na bujjhati.

example_1:
yassa loke sakaṃ n'atthi,
asatā ca na socati,
dhammesu ca na gacchati,
sa ve santo'ti vuccatī'ti.
example_2: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya piyarūpe dhamme adhimuccati, appiyarūpe dhamme byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.
sbs_example_3: rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati vedanāpaccayā taṇhā.

example_1:

muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃ'va dassayaṃ,
ummattaken'eva mayā palobhasi,
kiñ'c'āpi te citta virādhitaṃ mayā.
example_2: saññasaññino vuccanti ye pakatisaññāya ṭhitā, na'pi so pakatisaññāya ṭhito. visaññasaññino vuccanti ummattakā ye ca khittacittā, na'pi so ummattako, no'pi khittacitto'ti.
sbs_example_3: ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yad'idaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yad'idaṃ naccaṃ.

example_1:
vivekaññ'eva sikkhetha,
etadariyānam'uttamaṃ,
na tena seṭṭho maññetha,
sa ve nibbānasantike.
example_2: idha, gahapati, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṃ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṃ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati
sbs_example_3: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

commentary: (VIN 1.2.10) bhedāya parakkameyyā'ti, kathaṃ ime nānā assu, vinā assu, vaggā assū'ti pakkhaṃ pariyesati, gaṇaṃ bandhati.
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññam'aññaṃ kāressāma, siyā'pi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
sbs_example_3: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yadā dvayesu dhammesu,
pāragū hoti brāhmaṇo,
ath'assa sabbe saṃyogā,
atthaṃ gacchanti jānato.
example_2:
atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
sbs_example_3:
phuṭṭhassa lokadhammehi, cittaṃ yassa na kampati.
asokaṃ virajaṃ khemaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
sabbe dhammā anattā'ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.
sbs_example_5: n'āhaṃ aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: balavā puriso jivh'agge kheḷapiṇḍaṃ saṃyūhitvā appakasirena vameyya
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3:
pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ, vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā.
marīcik'ūpamā saññā, saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā.
māy'ūpamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ, desit'ādicca'bandhunā.

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkameyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: pānīyaparibhojanīy'ūpaṭṭhapanañ'ca, chandaarahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chandaāharaṇañ'ca, tesaññ'eva akat'uposathānaṃ pārisuddhiyā'pi āharaṇañ'ca

example_1: agilānena bhikkhunā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā aññatra punapavāraṇāya, aññatra niccapavāraṇāya. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilāna-ppaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ
sbs_example_3: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjhaparamatāyā
sbs_example_4:
jīvitānaṃ parikkhāre, bhesajje atha paccaye.
na bāḷhaṃ ussukā āsuṃ, yathā te āsavakkhaye

example_1: addasā kho aññataro upāsako taṃ bhikkhuṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ. disvāna yena so bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca, api, bhante, piṇḍo labbhatī'ti?
example_2:
sa piṇḍacāraṃ caritvā,
vanantam'abhihāraye,
upaṭṭhito rukkhamūlasmiṃ,
āsan'ūpagato muni.
sbs_example_3: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso piṇḍapātaṃ paṭisevāmi n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya vihiṃsūparatiyā brahmacariyānuggahāya
sbs_example_4: so pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

meaning_1: group; host; company; collection; multitude; mass
example_1: tena sudaṃ, bhante, devatā tāvatiṃsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā'ti
example_2:
mahāsamayo pavanasmiṃ,
devakāyā samāgatā,
āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ,
dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghan'ti.
sbs_example_3:
passa cittakataṃ bimbaṃ, arukāyaṃ samussitaṃ,
āturaṃ bahusaṅkappaṃ, yassa n'atthi dhuvaṃ ṭhiti.
sbs_example_4: ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacce sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ?
sbs_example_5: seyyathā'pi rañño paccantime nagare bahubalakāyo paṭivasati, evam'evaṃ kho ariyasāvako āraddhavīriyo viharati, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.

example_1:
rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.
example_2: appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, parihāni yadidaṃ bhogaparihāni. etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī'ti.
sbs_example_3: ñātibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, bhogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, sīlabyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa, diṭṭhibyasanena vā phuṭṭhassa
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi puriso bandhanāgāre baddho assa. so aparena samayena tamhā bandhanā mucceyya sotthinā abbhayena, na c'assa kiñci bhogānaṃ vayo.
sbs_example_5: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
kodh'ātimānassa vasaṃ na gacche,
mūlam'pi tesaṃ palikhañña tiṭṭhe,
athappiyaṃ vā pana appiyaṃ vā,
addhā bhavanto abhisambhaveyya.
example_2: yadā kho te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā jhattā assu kilantā, atha kho yo nesaṃ pāṇakānaṃ balavataro assa tassa te anuvatteyyuṃ, anuvidhāyeyyuṃ vasaṃ gaccheyyuṃ.
sbs_example_3:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddhamānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, atthacintā vas'ānugā.
sbs_example_4: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū uppannāya taṇhāya ponobhavikāya na vasaṃ gacchissanti, vuddhi'y'eva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evaṃ vutte purimāni, bhante, divasāni purimatarāni, nānātitthiyānaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ kotūhalasālāya sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ abhisaññānirodhe kathā udapādi, kathaṃ nu kho, bho, abhisaññānirodho hotī'ti?
example_2: so tāya dhammapariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.
sbs_example_3: niṭṭhite ca pubbakicce, sace so divaso cātuddasīpaṇṇarasīsāmaggīnam'aññataro, yath'ājja uposatho paṇṇaraso.
sbs_example_4: idha bhikkhu divase nikkhante rattiyā patihitāya iti paṭisañcikkhati, bahukā kho me paccayā maraṇassa:

meaning_1: related to an offence requiring suspension; lit. related to an offence requiring involvement of the community from start to finish
commentary: (VINa) vacan'attho pan'ettha saṅgho ādimhi c'eva sese ca icchitabbo assā'ti saṅghādiseso.
example_1: ime kho pan'āyasmanto terasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
example_2: saṅghādiseso'ti saṅgho'va tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ deti, mūlāya paṭikassati, mānattaṃ deti, abbheti, na sambahulā, na ekapuggalo. tena vuccati, saṅghādiseso'ti.
sbs_example_3: nisajjaṃ bhikkhu paṭijānamāno tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena kāretabbo pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā, yena vā sā saddheyyavacasā upāsikā vadeyya, tena so bhikkhu kāretabbo, ayaṃ dhammo aniyato.

example_1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, akusalamūlāni. katamāni tīṇi? lobho akusalamūlaṃ, doso akusalamūlaṃ, moho akusalamūlaṃ
example_2:
piyā su lokasmiṃ kutonidānā,
ye v'āpi lobhā vicaranti loke,
āsā ca niṭṭhā ca kutonidānā,
ye samparāyāya narassa honti.
sbs_example_3:
na muṇḍakena samaṇo, abbato alikaṃ bhaṇaṃ.

example_1: devassa kho dānaṃ dīyati, amhākaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati. sādhu mayam'pi devaṃ nissāya dānāni dadeyyāma, puññāni kareyyāmā'ti.
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: n'eva tāv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho'ti paccaññāsiṃ
sbs_chant_eng_3: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, coraṃ āgucāriṃ gahetvā rañño dasseyyuṃ, ayaṃ te, deva, coro āgucārī, imassa yaṃ icchasi taṃ daṇḍaṃ paṇehī'ti.

meaning_1: pride; conceit; egotism; superiority; comparing oneself
example_1:
mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.
example_2:
dhonassa hi n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
pakappitā diṭṭhi bhav'ābhavesu,
māyañ'ca mānañ'ca pahāya dhono,
sa kena gaccheyya anūpayo so.

commentary:
(MNa) tattha kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho, caṇḍikkalakkhaṇo vā, āghātakaraṇaraso, dussanapaccupaṭṭhāno.
(ANa) paresu kujjhanalakkhaṇo kodho.
example_1:
kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3:
māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro, kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ.
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ, attā sudanto purisassa joti.
sbs_example_4: byāpannacittassa byāpādo pahīyetha, kodhanassa kodho pahīyetha, upanāhissa upanāho pahīyetha, makkhissa makkho pahīyetha, paḷāsissa paḷāso pahīyetha
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
example_2:
supinena yathā'pi saṅgataṃ,
paṭibuddho puriso na passati,
evam'pi piyāyitaṃ janaṃ,
petaṃ kālakataṃ na passati.
sbs_example_3: maraṇadhammo'mhi, maraṇaṃ anatītoti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya.
sbs_example_5: arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ
example_2: yo'pi c'ettha katakusalo hoti, tam'pi ñātirogabhogabyasan'ādīnaṃ aññatarena byasanena samannāgataṃ disvā vā sutvā vā tesaṃ abhāve'pi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ anatikkantattā, dukkhito'va ayan'ti.
sbs_example_3: maññitaṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, maññitaṃ gaṇḍo, maññitaṃ sallaṃ. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, amaññamānena cetasā viharissāmā'ti, evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: fool; worthless man; useless person; stupid person; lit. empty man
example_1: acchariyaṃ, moggallāna, abbhutaṃ, moggallāna! yāva bāhāgahaṇā'pi nāma so moghapuriso āgamessatī'ti
example_2: atha ca pan'idh'ekacce moghapurisā pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharitvā abhisaṅkharitvā tathāgataṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchanti.
sbs_example_3: kīva dūr'ev'ime, bhikkhave, moghapurisā apakkantā imamhā dhammavinayā.
sbs_example_4: idha ekacce moghapurisā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti—suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.

meaning_1: name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost monk in the divine eye; cousin of the Buddha
commentary: (AN 1.192) etad'aggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dibbacakkhukānaṃ yad'idaṃ anuruddho.
example_1: āyasmatā ca mahācundena āyasmatā ca anuruddhena āyasmatā ca revatena āyasmatā ca ānandena, aññehi ca abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ.
example_2: yato kho tvaṃ anuruddha ime aṭṭha mahāpurisavitakke vitakkessasi, tato tvaṃ anuruddha yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhissasi …
sbs_example_3: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti

meaning_1: battle; war; fight; lit. going together
example_1:
tass'eva tena pāpiyo,
yo kuddhaṃ paṭikujjhati,
kuddhaṃ appaṭikujjhanto,
saṅgāmaṃ jeti dujjayaṃ.
example_2:
yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.
sbs_example_3:
kileseh'ābhibhūtā te, tena tena vidhāvitā.
narā kilesavatthūsu, sasaṅgāme'va ghosite.

example_1:
pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.
example_2:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ,
phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.
sbs_example_3:
khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ.
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
sbs_example_4:
na dīgham'āyuṃ labhate dhanena, na c'āpi vittena jaraṃ vihanti.
appaṃ h'idaṃ jīvitam'āhu dhīrā, asassataṃ vippariṇāmadhammaṃ.
sbs_example_5:
yamhi saccañ'ca dhammo ca, ahiṃsā saṃyamo damo.
sa ve vantamalo dhīro, thero iti pavuccatī'ti.

example_1: santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṃ āgacchanti. te sakaṃ'y'eva vādaṃ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṃ pana khuṃsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṃ karonti.
example_2: te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma. evaṃ ce no puṭṭho evaṃ byākarissati, evam'assa mayaṃ vādaṃ āropessāma.
sbs_example_3: kām'upādānaṃ, diṭṭh'upādānaṃ, sīlabbat'upādānaṃ, attavād'upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
yehi vivitto vicareyya loke,
na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā,
jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho,
kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
sbs_example_5: pacchā vacanīyaṃ pure avaca. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo

example_1:
kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,

example_2: kathañ'ca bhikkhu ariyo hoti? ārak'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā.

notes: (PED) perhaps identical with mādisa (lit. like me)
example_1: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
example_2: añña'd'atthu pañjaliko'va naṃ yācati, dehi me, mārisa, urabbhaṃ vā urabbhadhanaṃ vā'ti.
sbs_example_3: kathaṃ nu tvaṃ, mārisa, ogham'atarī'ti? appatiṭṭhaṃ khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, anāyūhaṃ ogham'atarin'ti.

meaning_1: truth; reality; principle; truth behind the teaching
example_1: alaṃ, vakkali, kiṃ te iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena? yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati so maṃ passati, yo maṃ passati so dhammaṃ passati
example_2:
na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.
sbs_example_3: katame ca bhikkhave satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
sbs_example_4: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā. sambhedaṃ loko agamissa, yathā ajeḷakā kukkuṭasūkarā soṇasiṅgālā.

example_1: na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhana-atthaṃ, na janalapana-atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃsa-atthaṃ, na itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃsa-atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti
example_2:
ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.
sbs_example_3:
karaṇīyam'atthakusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,

example_1: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ
example_2:
yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.
sbs_example_3: jhānapaccayo, maggapaccayo, sampayuttapaccayo, vippayuttapaccayo, atthipaccayo, n'atthipaccayo, vigatapaccayo, avigatapaccayo.
sbs_example_4: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
sbs_example_5: siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno koci'd'eva paccayo tena cīvarena vippavāsāya, chārattaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tena cīvarena vippavasitabbaṃ.

example_1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso dāso assa anatt'ādhīno par'ādhīno na yenakāmaṃgamo
example_2:

gav'assaṃ dāsaporisaṃ,
thiyo bandhū puthu kāme,
yo naro anugijjhati.
sbs_example_3: itthikumārikapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, dāsidāsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi vadhukā yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā ānītā hoti, tāva'd'ev'assā tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sassuyā'pi sasure'pi sāmike'pi antamaso dāsakammakaraporisesu

example_1:
puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, rāhula, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato purimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti, pacchimehi'pi pādehi kammaṃ karoti

meaning_1: praxis (of); practice (of); devotion (to); pursuit (of); doing (of); lit. yoking near

sammāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
seyyaso naṃ tato kare.
example_2: so ñātakehi nīyamāno appatvā'va ñātake antarāmagge kālaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco yodh'ājīvo hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo yodh'ājīvo santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3:
dānañ'ca dhammacariyā ca, ñātakānañ'ca saṅgaho.
anavajjāni kammāni, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.
example_2: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, vedanākāyā, cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manosamphassajā vedanā.
sbs_example_3: chayime, bhikkhave, phassakāyā, cakkhusamphasso, sotasamphasso, ghānasamphasso, jivhāsamphasso, kāyasamphasso, manosamphasso. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, phasso.

example_1: paṇḍitā h'āvuso manussā vīmaṃsakā kismiṃ pan'āyasmantānaṃ chandarāgavinayakkhāyī satthā'ti
example_2:
ath'āparaṃ pañca rajāni loke,
yesaṃ satīmā vinayāya sikkhe,
rūpesu saddesu atho rasesu,
gandhesu phassesu sahetha rāgaṃ.
sbs_example_3: chandajaṃ aghaṃ chandajaṃ dukkhaṃ, chandavinayā aghavinayo, aghavinayā dukkhavinayo'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: state of loss; state of misery; lit. going away
commentary: (ANa) apāyo'ti niraya-tiracchānayoni-pettivisaya-asurakāyā. sabbe'pi hi te vaḍḍhisaṅkhātassa āyassa abhāvato apāyā'ti vuccanti.
example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu?
example_2: ayaṃ varāko kiñ'c'āpi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
catūha-apāyehi ca vippamutto,
cha cābhiṭhānāni abhabbo kātuṃ
sbs_example_4: micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: way; means; method; figure of speech; way of saying; method of presentation; lit. going around
example_1: atthi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca, atthi ca kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā ek'atthā, byañjanam'eva nānaṃ.
example_2: siyā pan'āvuso aññopi pariyāyo yathā ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti
sbs_example_3: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti, evam'evaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe,
suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa,
ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.
example_2:
yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ c'ūpasevati,
sa ve tādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi tādiso.
sbs_example_3: brahmamārā ca indā ca lokapālā ca devatā, yamo, mittā manussā ca majjhattā verikā'pi ca, sabbe sattā sukhī hontu.
sbs_example_4: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam'anussaraṃ.
sbs_example_5: yathārūpe anāsane nisinnaṃ yathārūpe agocare carantaṃ, yathārūpe pāpake mitte bhajantaṃ viññū sabrahmacārī pāpakesu ṭhānesu okappeyyuṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
andhabhūto ayaṃ loko,
tanuk'ettha vipassati,
sakuṇo jālamutto'va,
appo saggāya gacchati.
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti sapattabhāro'va ḍeti
sbs_example_3: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (either protective or malevolent) spirit; supernatural being; demon
example_1: sace vijānāsi vadehi yakkhā'ti.
example_2:
annam'ev'ābhinandanti,
ubhaye devamānusā,
atha ko nāma so yakkho,
yaṃ annaṃ n'ābhinandatī'ti.
sbs_example_3: bhummā c'āyantu devā jalathalavisame yakkhagandhabbanāgā tiṭṭhantā santike, yaṃ munivaravacanaṃ sādhavo me suṇantu
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_2:
āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti,
kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ,
te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.
sbs_example_3: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
sbs_example_4: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti
sbs_example_5:
upaṭṭhāpenti parisaṃ, kammato no ca dhammato.
dhammaṃ paresaṃ desenti, lābhato no ca atthato.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.
example_2:
pāpāni parivajjeti,
sa munī tena so muni,
yo munāti ubho loke,
muni tena pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: bhagavā pana, bhante, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pahoti tathā kātuṃ yathā sabbo loko kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti?
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
rājato vā upasaggaṃ,
abbhakkhānañ'ca dāruṇaṃ,
parikkhayañ'ca ñātīnaṃ,
bhogānañ'ca pabhaṅguraṃ.
example_2: taṃ vā pana anabhisambhavaṃ appaṭivijjhaṃ pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti.
sbs_example_3: balavā puriso divasaṃsantatte ayokaṭāhe dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni nipāteyya. dandho, ānanda, udakaphusitānaṃ nipāto, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: family name; lit. descendant of Kassapa
example_1: ye'pi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyath'idaṃ, pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo
example_2: abhijānām'ahaṃ, bho gotama, pūraṇaṃ kassapaṃ vādena vādaṃ samārabhitā. so'pi mayā vādena vādaṃ samāraddho aññen'aññaṃ paṭicari, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmesi, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātvākāsi.
sbs_example_3: āyasmatā ca sāriputtena āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena āyasmatā ca mahākassapena āyasmatā ca mahākaccāyanena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena āyasmatā ca mahākappinena
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā daṇḍam'olubbha ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi
example_2: alaṃ, āvuso dāsaka, kiṃ imāya sandhāvanikāya! āhar'āvuso, daṇḍaṃ, aham'eva yena therā bhikkhū ten'upasaṅkamissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyaṇaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantaṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati
example_2: ayañ'hi dīp'obhāsaṃ vā aggi'obhāsaṃ vā adisvā maṇiāloken'eva bhuñjati ca nisīdati ca nipajjati ca, devo pana dīp'ālokena nisinno bhavissatī'ti?
sbs_example_3: ayañ'ca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampi sampakampi sampavedhi appamāṇo ca oḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamm'eva devānaṃ dev'ānubhāvaṃ.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma
sbs_example_4:
obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ, cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso.
tādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja, kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasī'ti.

example_1:
na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjati so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.
example_2:
majjhe yathā samuddassa,
ūmi no jāyatī ṭhito hoti,
evaṃ ṭhito anejassa,
ussadaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci.
sbs_example_3: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti
sbs_example_4:
seyyathā'pi mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso,
evam'eva kho ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso.

meaning_1: titan; enemy of the devas; lit. anti-hero
example_1: tena sudaṃ, bhante, devatā tāvatiṃsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā'ti
example_2:
eko'va indo asure jināti,
eko'va seno hanti dije pasayha,
eko'va byaggho migasaṅghapatto,
varaṃ varaṃ hanti balañ'hi tādisaṃ.
sbs_example_3: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṃ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākāsa-anañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma
example_2:
anusāsa brahme karuṇāyamāno,
vivekadhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
yath'āhaṃ ākāso'va abyāpajjamāno,
idh'eva santo asito careyyaṃ.
sbs_example_3: atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākās'ānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇ'añc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: cattāro'me, bhikkhave, kālā sammā bhāviyamānā sammā anuparivattiyamānā anupubbena āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpenti
example_2: sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.
sbs_example_3: atthi nu kho me uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, so'haṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti
sbs_chant_eng_3: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: aññātavāde na saṇṭhātī'ti aññātavāde jānitavāde na saṇṭhāti. kathaṃ? ekacco pañhaṃ pucchati, taṃ itaro, manāpo tayā pañho pucchito, kahaṃ te esa uggahito'ti vadati.
example_2: sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.
sbs_example_3: atthi bhikkhave pañho ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho ṭhapanīyo.
sbs_example_4: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: mansion; stately home; palace; building with pillars
example_1: tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?
example_2: tena kho pana samayena bārāṇasiyaṃ yaso nāma kulaputto seṭṭhiputto sukhumālo hoti. tassa tayo pāsādā honti, eko hem'antiko, eko gimhiko, eko vassiko.
sbs_example_3: atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṃ vassikaṃ ekaṃ hem'antikaṃ ekaṃ gimhikaṃ, pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi
sbs_example_4:
pamādaṃ appamādena, yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha, asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe, dhīro bāle avekkhati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ,
saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ,
ratiyo patthayantena,
uḷārā apar'āparā.
example_2: tesaṃ taṃ vaṇṇāya c'eva hoti balāya ca, na ca tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.
sbs_example_3: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
sbs_example_4: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhāṇado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ'ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh'āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth'ūpapajjatī'ti.
sbs_example_5:
abhivādanasīlissa, niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti, āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: name of a former monk; lit. good star sign
example_1: assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa vesāliyaṃ parisati evaṃ vācaṃ bhāsamānassa, n'atthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttarimanussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu tassa purisassa tasmiṃ vante puna bhottu'kamyatā assā'ti?
sbs_example_3: atha kho sunakkhatto licchaviputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sare hatthehi bhañjitvā,
katvāna kuṭim'acchisaṃ,
tena me sarabhaṅgo'ti,
nāmaṃ sammutiyā ahu.
example_2: tassa kusakaṇṭakā c'eva pāde vijjheyyuṃ, sarapattāni ca gattāni vilekheyyuṃ.
sbs_example_3: asītivassasahass'āyukesu, bhikkhave, manussesu ayaṃ jambudīpo avīci maññe phuṭo bhavissati manussehi, seyyathā'pi naḷavanaṃ vā saravanaṃ vā.

meaning_1: sage; intelligent person; wise man; smart person
commentary: (MNa) bāle ca paṇḍite cā'ti bālā ca paṇḍitā ca.
example_1:
selo yathā ekaghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu,
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.
example_2:
yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
ettāvat'aggaṃ nu vadanti h'eke,
yakkhassa suddhiṃ idha paṇḍitāse,
udāhu aññam'pi vadanti etto.
sbs_example_3:
asevanā ca bālānaṃ, paṇḍitānañ'ca sevanā.
pūjā ca pūjanīyānaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ, yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ, tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa, seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.
sbs_example_5:
kalyāṇamittatā muninā, lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā.
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno, api bālo paṇḍito assa.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yattha nu kho, bhante, na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, sakkā nu kho so, bhante, gamanena lokassa anto ñātuṃ vā daṭṭhuṃ vā pāpuṇituṃ vā'ti?
example_2:
es'ūpamā dāmali brāhmaṇassa,
khīṇ'āsavassa nipakassa jhāyino,
pappuyya jātimaraṇassa antaṃ,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'ti.
sbs_example_3: appevanām'imassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyā paññāyethā'ti
sbs_example_4: na c'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatvā'va lokassa antaṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, balavā puriso dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ sīse vā gale vā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya.
example_2: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ kullaṃ sīse vā āropetvā khandhe vā uccāretvā yena kāmaṃ pakkameyyan'ti.
sbs_example_3: aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ, aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ, gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ, jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ, ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ, kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ, phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ, piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ, khandha-aṭṭhikaṃ, gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ

example_1:
na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.
example_2: nacca-gīta-vādita-visūka-dassanā paṭivirato hoti mālā-gandha-vilepana-dhāraṇa-maṇḍana-vibhūsana-ṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti

example_1:

meaning_1: family name; lit. descendant of Kati

commentary:
(MNa) pañcasu kāmaguṇesu cittavossaggalakkhaṇo pamādo, vossagg'ānuppadānaraso, sativippavāsapaccupaṭṭhāno'ti
(MNa) pamādan'ti vissaṭṭhasatibhāvaṃ.
(SNa) pamādā cā'ti ... sati-vippavāsa-lakkhaṇena pamādena ca.
(SNa) pamādo'ti niddāya vā kilesavasena vā pamādo.
example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.
example_2:
appamādo amatapadaṃ,
pamādo maccuno padaṃ,
appamattā na mīyanti,
ye pamattā yathā matā.
sbs_example_3:
pamādo rajo pamādo, pamād'ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya, abbahe sallam'attano'ti.
sbs_example_4: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādoattha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, bahalapattapalāso sandacchāyo kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko, seyyathā'pi nigrodho'ti.
example_2: khandhabījaṃ nāma, assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi khandhe jāyanti, khandhe sañjāyanti, etaṃ khandhabījaṃ nāma.

example_1:

example_2: codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo
sbs_example_3: codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu kho'mhi?' parisuddhavacīsamācāro nu kho'mhi?'

meaning_1: dislike; ill-will; hatred; hostility; enmity; malevolence; lit. going wrong
commentary: (ANa) byāpajjati iminā cittaṃ pūtikummās'ādayo viya purimapakatiṃ pajahatī'ti byāpādo.
example_1: mettaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. mettañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo byāpādo so pahīyissati.
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
sbs_example_3: byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti

meaning_1: enters; gets involved (with); engages (in); lit. approaches
example_1:
vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke,
atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,
vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti,
tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.
example_2:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ,
anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi,
adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.
sbs_example_3: upay'upādān'ābhinivesavinibandho khv'āyaṃ, kaccāna, loko yebhuyyena. tañ'c'āyaṃ upay'upādānaṃ cetaso adhiṭṭhānaṃ abhinives'ānusayaṃ na upeti na upādiyati n'ādhiṭṭhāti, attā me'ti.
sbs_example_4: so rūpaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti attā me'ti.

meaning_1: falls down; falls forward; falls off; falls (into)
example_1: te jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā jarāsaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre abhisaṅkharitvā ... jātipapātam'pi papatanti, jarāpapātam'pi papatanti
example_2: evañ'hi, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa hoti, imaṃ c'āhaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ papatissāmi, tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti
sbs_example_3: upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṃ nāma kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷati, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ sāṇadhovikaṃ maññe kīḷitajātaṃ kīḷissāmi.
example_2: sa kho so, bhikkhave, kumāro vuddhim'anvāya indriyānaṃ paripākam'anvāya yāni tāni kumārakānaṃ kīḷāpanakāni tehi kīḷati, seyyath'idaṃ, vaṅkakaṃ ghaṭikaṃ mokkhacikaṃ ciṅgulakaṃ patt'āḷhakaṃ rathakaṃ dhanukaṃ.
sbs_example_3:
te kilesā pavaḍḍhantā, āvisanti bahuṃ janaṃ.
kīḷanti maññe bālehi, ummattehi'va rakkhasā.
