example_1:
hīnaṃ dhammaṃ na seveyya,
pamādena na saṃvase,
micchādiṭṭhiṃ na seveyya,
na siyā lokavaḍḍhano.
example_2:
āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.
sbs_example_3: tayo satipaṭṭhānā yad'ariyo sevati yad'ariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yogg'ācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: believes (in); has faith (in); has confidence (in); has conviction (in)
example_1: idh'āvuso bhikkhu saddho hoti saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ
example_2: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṃ vuccati saddh'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassa so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā mittato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, suhajjato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, tasmiñ'ca vissāsaṃ āpajjeyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti
example_2: so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī'ti.
sbs_example_3: tassa sā sukhā vedanā nirujjhati. sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā uppajjati dukkhā vedanā. so dukkhāya vedanāya phuṭṭho samāno socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: feels; experiences; senses; lit. causes to know
example_1: ko nu kho, bhante, vedayatī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, vedayatī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.
example_2: kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, vedanaṃ vadetha? vedayatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā vedanā'ti vuccati. kiñ'ca vedayati? sukham'pi vedayati, dukkham'pi vedayati, adukkham'asukham'pi vedayati
sbs_example_3: tassa kismiñci'd'eva pasādanīye nimitte cittaṃ paṇidahato pāmojjaṃ jāyati. pamuditassa pīti jāyati. pītimanassa kāyo passambhati. passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vedayati. sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.
example_2: hivibhatti lopam'āpajjate vā. gaccha, gacchāhi, gama, gamāhi, gamaya, gamayāhi. hī'ti kim'atthaṃ? gacchati, gamayati.
sbs_example_3: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: approaches; goes (to); visits; lit. goes near
example_1: sace bhavaṃ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.
example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. tena kho pana samayena aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.
sbs_example_3: tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na uccāsoṇḍaṃ paggahetvā kulāni upasaṅkamissāmī'ti
sbs_example_4: idha saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati,
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (ANa) taṃ te mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāmā'ti taṃ tava aparādhaṃ mayaṃ khamāma.
example_1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.
example_2: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.
sbs_example_3: taṃ veraṃ n'ābhinandāmi, paṭiggaṇhāmi vo'ccayan'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ovadeyya-anusāseyya,
asabbhā ca nivāraye,
satañ'hi so piyo hoti,
asataṃ hoti appiyo.
example_2: ovadatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, anusāsatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
tad'ahu pabbajito santo, jātiyā sattavassiko.
so pi maṃ anusāseyya, sampaṭicchāmi muddhanā
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (ANa) namassantī'ti kāyena namassanti, vācāya namassanti, manasā namassanti, dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipattiyā namassanti, sakkaronti garuṃ karonti.
example_1:
tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca.
example_2: no ce haritāni tiṇāni āmaseyyāsi, aggiṃ paricareyyāsi. no ce aggiṃ paricareyyāsi, pañjaliko ādiccaṃ namasseyyāsi
sbs_example_3: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, dhammaṃ namassāmi
sbs_example_4: arahante sītībhūte, katakicce anāsave nihacca mānaṃ athaddho, te namasse anuttare'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
puriso aṅkusam'ādāya,
dehi pādan'ti yācati,
nāgo pasārayī pādaṃ,
puriso nāgam'āruhi.
example_2: añña'd'atthu pañjaliko'va naṃ yācati, dehi me, mārisa, urabbhaṃ vā urabbhadhanaṃ vā'ti.
sbs_example_3: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho. ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ. so saṅghaṃ kuṭivatthuolokanaṃ yācati.
sbs_example_4: ettha dāni, māluṅkyaputta, kiṃ dahare bhikkhū vakkhāma yatra hi nāma tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto saṃkhittena ovādaṃ yācasī'ti.
sbs_example_5: tasmā n'ābhikkhaṇaṃ gacche, na ca gacche cirāciraṃ. kālena yācaṃ yāceyya, evaṃ mittā na jīyare.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati
example_2:
idha chinditamārite,
hatajānīsu kassapo,
na pāpaṃ samanupassati,
puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.
sbs_example_3: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
sbs_example_4: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan'ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.
sbs_example_5: “n'āhaṃ aññaṃ eka-dhammam'pi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo uppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo bhiyyo-bhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati yatha'y'idaṃ paṭighanimittaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VINa) dutiyapadaṃ aññesaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ harantassa gacchato vasena
example_1:
dinnaṃ sukhaphalaṃ hoti,
n'ādinnaṃ hoti taṃ tathā,
corā haranti rājāno,
aggi ḍahati nassati.
example_2: theyyasaṅkhātan'ti ādiyeyyā'ti ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.
sbs_example_3: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh'ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin'ti me bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: katamā c'āvuso, suññatā cetovimutti? idh'āvuso, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, suññam'idaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā'ti. ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, suññatā cetovimutti.
example_2: so iti paṭisañcikkhati yassa khv'āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno
sbs_example_3: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
sbs_example_4: sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo kho, sabhiya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, so cattāro māse parivasati.
example_2:
bhikkhu siyā jhāyī vimuttacitto,
ākaṅkhe ce hadayass'ānupattiṃ,
lokassa ñatvā udayabbayañ'ca,
sucetaso anissito tadānisaṃso'ti.
sbs_example_3: so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākamm'ūpage satte pajāneyyaṃ
sbs_example_4: sace ākaṅkhati, paṭikūlañ'ca appaṭikūlañ'ca tad'ubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti
sbs_example_5: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vasī vitakkapariyāyapathesu. yaṃ vitakkaṃ ākaṅkhissati taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati, yaṃ vitakkaṃ nākaṅkhissati na taṃ vitakkaṃ vitakkessati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṃ pajānāti evaṃ passati, ayaṃ vuccati, sot'āpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano'ti.
example_2: tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti
sbs_example_3: so idaṃ dukkhan'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho'ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
sbs_example_4: so sato'va assasati, sato'va passasati. dīghaṃ vā assasanto dīghaṃ assasāmī'ti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto dīghaṃ passasāmī'ti pajānāti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: brings (for); brings back (for); fetches (for); procures (for); lit. brings here
example_1: kathañ'ca, visākhe, mātugāmo sambhataṃ anurakkhati? idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.
example_2: atha puriso āgaccheyya, ahaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ daḷhadhammānaṃ dhanuggahānaṃ susikkhitānaṃ katahatthānaṃ kat'ūpāsanānaṃ catuddisā kaṇḍe khitte appatiṭṭhite pathaviyaṃ gahetvā āharissāmī'ti.
sbs_example_3: so evaṃ vadeyya, alaṃ me, bho, tāya vīṇāya, tam'eva me saddaṃ āharathā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sa ve indriyasampanno,
santo santipade rato,
dhāreti antimaṃ dehaṃ,
jetvā māraṃ savāhinin'ti.
example_2: tasmā te cakkhūni nassantu vā bhijjantu vā, buddhasāsanam'eva dhārehi, mā cakkhūnī'ti
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṃ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṃ rathaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho assadoso.
example_2: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca appamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otareyya. tam'enaṃ kiṭṭh'ārakkho nāsāyaṃ suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: (of meditation attainments or Nibbāna) experiences; reaches; attains; achieves; lit. touches
example_1:
bhāvehi jhānāni ca indriyāni ca,
balāni bojjh'aṅgasamādhibhāvanā,
tisso ca vijjā phusa buddhasāsane,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2: so abhijānanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, parijānanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, pajahanto ekaṃ dhammaṃ, sacchikaronto ekaṃ dhammaṃ sammāvimuttiṃ phusati.
sbs_example_3:
saritvā pubbake yogī, tesaṃ vattam'anussaraṃ.
kiñ'c'āpi pacchimo kālo, phuseyya amataṃ padaṃ.
sbs_example_4:
te jhāyino sātatikā, niccaṃ daḷhaparakkamā,
phusanti dhīrā nibbānaṃ, yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,
n'ev'attato no parato dahetha,
phusanti phassā upadhiṃ paṭicca,
nirūpadhiṃ kena phuseyyu phassā'ti.
example_2:
phasso nu lokasmi kutonidāno,
pariggahā c'āpi kutopahūtā,
kismiṃ asante na mamattam'atthi,
kismiṃ vibhūte na phusanti phassā.
sbs_example_3: samaṃ pādaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati, samaṃ uddharati, samaṃ sabbāvantehi pādatalehi bhūmiṃ phusati.
sbs_example_4: ye te kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā asamphuṭṭhā asamphuṭṭhapubbā, na ca phusasi, na ca te hoti phuseyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti?

meaning_1: pulls up; pulls out; lifts up; raises
example_1:
appamādaratā hotha,
sacittam'anurakkhatha,
duggā uddharatha-attānaṃ,
paṅke sanno'va kuñjaro.
example_2: atha puriso āgaccheyya kuddālapiṭakaṃ ādāya. so taṃ māluvālataṃ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷamattāni'pi.
sbs_example_3: samaṃ pādaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati, samaṃ uddharati, samaṃ sabbāvantehi pādatalehi bhūmiṃ phusati.
sbs_example_4: so vata, cunda, attanā apalipapalipanno paraṃ palipapalipannaṃ uddharissatī'ti ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: puts down; places down; lays down; lit. throws down
example_1:
n'ābhinandāmi maraṇaṃ,
n'ābhinandāmi jīvitaṃ,
nikkhipissaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ,
sampajāno patissato.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ taṃ chetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃharitvā caturaṅgulaṃ caturaṅgulaṃ ghaṭikaṃ katvā nikkhipeyya
sbs_example_3: samaṃ pādaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipati, samaṃ uddharati, samaṃ sabbāvantehi pādatalehi bhūmiṃ phusati.

meaning_1: considers as; takes as; regards as; lit. puts
example_1:
gāme araññe sukhadukkhaphuṭṭho,
n'ev'attato no parato dahetha,
phusanti phassā upadhiṃ paṭicca,
nirūpadhiṃ kena phuseyyu phassā'ti.
example_2:
te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.
sbs_example_3: sakyā kho pana, ambaṭṭha, rājānaṃ okkākaṃ pitāmahaṃ dahanti.

commentary:
(MNa) paribhāsantī'ti tayā idañ'c'idañ'ca kataṃ, evañ'ca evañ'ca taṃ karissāmā'ti vācāya paribhāsanti.
(SNa) paribhāsissantī'ti kiṃ samaṇo nāma tvaṃ, idañ'c'idañ'ca te karissāmā'ti tajjessanti.
example_1:
yo buddhaṃ paribhāsati,
atha vā tassa sāvakaṃ,
paribbājaṃ gahaṭṭhaṃ vā,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2: evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo. taṃ kissa hetu? akkoseyya'pi maṃ paribhāseyya'pi maṃ anattham'pi maṃ kareyyā'ti.
sbs_example_3: sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kin'ti bhavissatī'ti?

example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

example_1:

yo vatthaṃ paridahissati,

example_2: deva, idāni ṭhapetvā saccakiriyaṃ añño mama sakkhi n'atthi, sac'āyaṃ dārako tumhe paṭicca jāto, ākāse tiṭṭhatu, no ce, bhūmiyaṃ patitvā maratū'ti bodhisattassa pāde gahetvā ākāse khipi.

example_1:

example_2:
tasmā pattapuṭass'eva,
ñatvā sampākam'attano,

example_2:

meaning_1: keeps; stores; saves; sets aside; lays aside; lit. throws down
example_1: tam'enaṃ sāmikā gandhaparibhāvite karaṇḍake nikkhipanti. yo'pi'ssa hoti anusahagato ūsagandho vā khāragandho vā gomayagandho vā asamūhato, so'pi samugghātaṃ gacchati.
example_2: accekaṃ maññamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ, paṭiggahetvā yāva cīvarakālasamayaṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

example_1:

example_1: sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu! app'iccho so, bhikkhu, kulaputto. sante'y'eva attani kusaladhamme na icchati parehi ñāyamāne.
example_2:

example_1: sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.
example_2: avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'evama bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya

example_2: so tattha dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedeti, na ca tāva kālaṅ'karoti yāva na taṃ pāpakammaṃ byantīhoti.

example_1: dīgharattaṃ kho maṃ tvaṃ, devi, iṭṭhehi kantehi piyehi manāpehi samudācarittha, atha ca pana maṃ tvaṃ pacchime kāle aniṭṭhehi akantehi appiyehi amanāpehi samudācarasī'ti
example_2: tassa evaṃ hoti, yo kho my'āyaṃ puggalo iṭṭho kanto manāpo, taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācarantī'ti. so tesu pemaṃ janeti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pemā pemaṃ jāyati.

example_1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti. katame aṭṭha?

meaning_1: comprehends; understands; recognises; distinguishes; is aware (of)
example_1: viññāṇaṃ viññāṇan'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, viññāṇan'ti vuccatī'ti? vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇan'ti vuccati.

dutiyaṃ bhagavā brūhi, kiṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

meaning_1: remains still; stands still; settles down

notes: passive in form, active in meaning.
example_1: na kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ettāvatā saupavajjo'ti vadāmi. yo kho, sāriputta, tañ'ca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, aññañ'ca kāyaṃ upādiyati, tam'ahaṃ saupavajjo'ti vadāmi.
example_2: so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.
sbs_example_3: yāva'd'eva ñāṇamattāya paṭissatimattāya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiñci loke upādiyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: directly knew; understood experientially; realized; lit. completely knew
example_1: yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ. taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāsi.
example_2: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā'ti abbhaññāsi.
sbs_example_3: yato ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ evaṃ assādañ'ca assādato ādīnavañ'ca ādīnavato nissaraṇañ'ca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: palms placed together (as a token of respect)
example_1: tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo
example_2: tassa heṭṭhābhāgaṃ sodhāpetvā pākāraparikkhepaṃ kārāpetvā vālukaṃ okirāpetvā dhajapaṭākaṃ ussāpetvā vanappatiṃ alaṅ'karitvā añjaliṃ karitvā, sace puttaṃ vā dhītaraṃ vā labheyyaṃ, tumhākaṃ mahāsakkāraṃ karissāmī'ti patthanaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
sbs_example_3: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
sbs_example_4: atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tena-añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato,
dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
dhammaṃ anussaraṃ bhikkhu,
saddhammā na parihāyati.
example_2: so tena ñāṇadassanena na majjati nappamajjati na pamādaṃ āpajjati, appamatto samāno asamayavimokkhaṃ ārādheti. aṭṭhānam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ so bhikkhu tāya asamayavimuttiyā parihāyetha.
sbs_example_3: veditabbam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā parihāyāmi kusalehi dhammehi'. parihānañ'h'etaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā'ti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (SNa) dāy'ādā vindare dhanan'ti tassa dāy'ādā'pi dhanaṃ na vindanti.
example_1:
tesaṃ sampannasīlānaṃ,
appamādavihārinaṃ,
samma'd'aññā vimuttānaṃ,
māro maggaṃ na vindati.
example_2:
yañ'ca kho sīlasampanno,
bhikkhu ḍahati tejasā,
na tassa puttā pasavo,
dāy'ādā vindare dhanaṃ,
anapaccā adāy'ādā,
tāl'āvatthū bhavanti te.
sbs_example_3:
uṭṭhānakālamhi anuṭṭhahāno, yuvā balī ālasiyaṃ upeto,
saṃsannasaṅkappamano kusīto, paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yaṃ me kaṅkhitam'aññāsi,
vicikicchā maṃ tārayi namo te,
muni monapathesu pattipatta,
akhila ādiccabandhu sorato'si.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi, aññāsi vata bho koṇḍañño, aññāsi vata bho koṇḍañño'ti!
sbs_example_3: upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti, tadā'pi so vadhako'va. vadhakañ'ca pana santaṃ na aññāsi, vadhako me'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho taṃ mahābrahmānaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
example_2: atha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi.
sbs_example_3: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: tāvataken'eva tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjeyyātha
example_2: evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na c'eva sampāyissanti, uttariñ'ca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti. taṃ kissa hetu? yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.
sbs_example_3: tassā puriso sotena vuyhamāno kāse ce'pi gaṇheyya, te palujjeyyuṃ. so tatonidānaṃ anayabyasanaṃ āpajjeyya.
sbs_example_4: katamo ca, brāhmaṇa, maraṇadhammo samāno bhāyati, santāsaṃ āpajjati maraṇassa?
sbs_example_5: api ca kho mātugāmassa ucchādanaparimaddananhāpanasambāhanaṃ sādiyati. so taṃ assādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: practices; engages (in); commits (to); does; lit. yokes near
example_1: so tāya dhammapariyattiyā na divasaṃ atināmeti, n'āpi riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hoti.
example_2: sukhavinicchayaṃ jaññā, sukhavinicchayaṃ ñatvā ajjhattaṃ sukham'anuyuñjeyya.
sbs_example_3:
surāmerayapānañ'ca, yo naro anuyuñjati.
idh'evam'eso lokasmiṃ, mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: harms; hurts; injures; (comm) hurts; kills; destroys
example_1:
sukhakāmāni bhūtāni,
yo daṇḍena na hiṃsati,
attano sukham'esāno,
pecca so labhate sukhaṃ.
example_2:
na tena ariyo hoti,
yena pāṇāni hiṃsati,
ahiṃsā sabbapāṇānaṃ,
ariyo'ti pavuccati.
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi usabho chinnavisāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvāhiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā
sbs_example_4:
yo'dha koci manussesu, parapāṇāni hiṃsati.
asmā lokā paramhā ca, ubhayā dhaṃsate naro.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: follows a path; undertake a journey; travels
example_1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, dve jāyampatikā parittaṃ sambalaṃ ādāya kantāramaggaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ
sbs_example_3: seyyathā'pi puriso sadhano sabhogo kantār'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya. so aparena samayena tamhā kantārā nitthareyya sotthinā abbhayena, na c'assa kiñci bhogānaṃ vayo.
sbs_example_4: so tehi yācitakehi bhogehi purakkhato parivuto antar'āpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyya.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato ahosiṃ nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī vihāsiṃ.
example_2: tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
sbs_example_3:
sabbe saddhammagaruno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca.
athā'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.
sbs_example_4: rājamahāmatto vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricārayamāno kāmataṇhaṃ appahāya kāmapariḷāhaṃ appaṭivinodetvā vigatapipāso ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto vihāsi vā viharati vā viharissati vā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: etha bhikkhavo'ti bhagavā avoca. svākkhāto dhammo caratha brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā'ti. sāva tesaṃ āyasmantānaṃ upasampadā ahosi
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi. siṅgālopi kho, bhikkhave, sāy'anhasamayaṃ anunadītīre gocarapasuto ahosi.
sbs_example_3: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
sbs_example_4: āraddhaṃ kho pana me vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ek'aggaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (MNa) pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharontī'ti dupadam'pi tipadam'pi catuppadam'pi pañhaṃ karonti.
example_1: sāmaṃ vā taṃ, ānanda, kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ. pare vā taṃ, ānanda, kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharonti, yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ.
example_2: te suṇanti, samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo amukaṃ nāma gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā osarissatī'ti. te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma.
sbs_example_3: rūpaṃ rūpattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, vedanaṃ vedanattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti, saññaṃ saññattāya saṅkhatam'abhisaṅkharonti
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ,
attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ,
abhimatthati dummedhaṃ,
vajiraṃ'v'asmamayaṃ maṇiṃ.
example_2: nappaṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā'ti.
sbs_example_3:
passa cittakataṃ rūpaṃ, maṇinā kuṇḍalena ca.
aṭṭhiṃ tacena onaddhaṃ, saha vatthehi sobhati.
sbs_example_4: seyyathā'pi, gahapati, puriso yācitakaṃ bhogaṃ yācitvā yānaṃ vā poriseyyaṃ pavaramaṇikuṇḍalaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha puriso āgaccheyya ghamm'ābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito. so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā tatth'eva rukkhacchāyāya nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā.
example_2: tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ ṭhito? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ nisīdeyyan'ti. so nisīdeyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ nisinno? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ nipajjeyyan'ti. so nipajjeyya.
sbs_example_3: nisīdati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati, nipajjati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: considers (to be); takes (as); regards (as); views (as); deems (as)
example_1:
yo ca sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca,
tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati,
karaṃ purisakiccāni,
so sukhā na vihāyati.
example_2: tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.
sbs_example_3:
madhu'vā maññati bālo, yāva pāpaṃ na paccati,
yadā ca paccati pāpaṃ, bālo dukkhaṃ nigacchati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa,
hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ,
n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti,
n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.
example_2: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.
sbs_example_3: idha, gahapati, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati, gahapati, cāgasampadā.
sbs_example_4: tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ubho kaṇṇasotāni āviñcheyyāsi, pāṇinā gattāni anumajjeyyāsi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
yass'indriyāni samathaṅ'gatāni,
assā yathā sārathinā sudantā,
pahīnamānassa anāsavassa,
devā'pi tassa pihayanti tādino.
example_2: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ sārathissa āvikattā hoti. tesam'assa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.
sbs_example_3: idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
na t'āhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito,
biḷārabhastaṃ'va yathā sumadditaṃ.
example_2: upanikkhittaṃ vā sādiyeyyā'ti idaṃ ayyassa hotū'ti upanikkhittaṃ sādiyati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
sbs_example_3:
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.
sbs_example_4: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na'y'idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe, evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_4: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya, evam'eva kho adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.
example_2: so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yen'eva pakkamati samādāy'eva pakkamati
sbs_example_3: hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati, pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati, pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati, kucchismiṃ sati jighacchā pipāsā paññāyati.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: attachment; taking as mine; appropriation; acquisition; sense of ownership; identification; lit. placing near
commentary: (MNa) upadhī hontī'ti khandhūpadhi kilesūpadhi abhisaṅkhārūpadhi pañcakāmaguṇ'ūpadhī'ti ime upadhayo honti.
example_1: upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
example_2: tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno upadhī honti samattā samādinnā. ty'āssa pahīnā honti ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
sbs_example_3: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yad'idaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabba-upadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan'ti.
sbs_example_4: idh'ānanda, bhikkhu upadhivivekā akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānā sabbaso kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyā vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

construction: vi > vy > by + ā + karo + ti
example_1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.
example_2: tena hi, gāmaṇi, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi. yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsī'ti.
sbs_example_3:
dv'āhaṃ sakkaṃ apucchissaṃ, na me byākāsi cakkhumā,
yāvatatiyañ'ca dev'īsi, byākarotī'ti me sutaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: explain; defines; describes; lit. makes distinct
construction: vi > vy > by + ā + karo + ti
example_1: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā parito parito janapadesu paricārake abbhatīte kālaṅ'kate upapattīsu byākaroti
example_2: kathaṃ byākaramānā ... dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākareyyāma, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānupāto gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti?
sbs_example_3: āyām'āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
example_2: yadā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ na abhininnāmi, atha siṅgālo kummamhā nibbijja pakkāmi, otāraṃ alabhamāno.
sbs_example_3: āyasmā ānando tā bhikkhuniyo dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkāmi
sbs_example_4: atha kho so, bhikkhave, mudumūsi gocarāya pakkāmi. tam'enaṃ biḷāro gahetvā sahasā asaṅkhāditvā ajjhohari.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: bhaggesu suṃsumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye antarahito cetīsu pācīnavaṃsadāye āyasmato anuruddhassa sammukhe pāturahosi
example_2: evam'eva, suddh'āvāsesu devesu antarahitā bhagavato purato pāturahesuṃ. atha kho tā devatā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
sbs_example_3: ayañ'ca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkam'pi sampakam'pi sampavedhi, appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pāturahosi atikkamm'eva devānaṃ devānubhāvan'ti.
sbs_chant_eng_3: The Discourse on  Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

example_2: ekacce licchavī evam'āhaṃsu, kiṃ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yo bhagavato vādaṃ āropessati, atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṃ āropessatī'ti?

example_1: yo pana bhikkhu dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

commentary: (VIN 1.1.2) ādiyeyyā'ti ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.
example_1:
yo pāṇam'atipāteti,
musāvādañ'ca bhāsati,
loke adinnam'ādiyati,
paradārañ'ca gacchati.
example_2:
sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ na-adiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti,
idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi,
vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.
example_2:
ye keci pāṇabhūt'atthi,
tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā y'eva mahantā vā,
majjhimā rassakā aṇukathūlā.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

meaning_1: you (all) must be; may you (all) be
example_1: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamāda-attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo, m'āyasmā samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā,
paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā,
saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ,
te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā maggo gato hoti. tassa evaṃ hoti, ahaṃ kho maggaṃ agamāsiṃ. maggaṃ kho pana me gacchantassa kāyo kilanto. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1:
sv'āhaṃ idha pañca sikkhā karitvā,
paṭipajjitvā tathāgatassa dhamme,
dvepatham'agamāsiṃ coramajjhe,
te maṃ tattha vadhiṃsu bhogahetu.
example_2: evaṃ gacchante kāle ekaṃ nigamagāmaṃ agamāsi.
Feedback: Spot a mistake? Fix it here.

example_1: agamāsi kho, bhikkhave, so kummo taṃ padesaṃ. tam'enaṃ luddo papatāya vijjhi.
example_2: atha kho therā bhikkhū yathāvihāraṃ agamaṃsu. āyasmā'pi mahako sakaṃ vihāraṃ agamāsi.
